module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificateMetadata

-- | Contains information about a server certificate without its
--   certificate body, certificate chain, and private key.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   UploadServerCertificate and ListServerCertificates operations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServerCertificateMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data ServerCertificateMetadata
ServerCertificateMetadata' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ServerCertificateMetadata

-- | The date when the server certificate was uploaded.
[$sel:uploadDate:ServerCertificateMetadata'] :: ServerCertificateMetadata -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The date on which the certificate is set to expire.
[$sel:expiration:ServerCertificateMetadata'] :: ServerCertificateMetadata -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The path to the server certificate. For more information about paths,
--   see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:ServerCertificateMetadata'] :: ServerCertificateMetadata -> Text

-- | The name that identifies the server certificate.
[$sel:serverCertificateName:ServerCertificateMetadata'] :: ServerCertificateMetadata -> Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the server certificate. For
--   more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
[$sel:serverCertificateId:ServerCertificateMetadata'] :: ServerCertificateMetadata -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the server certificate. For
--   more information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:arn:ServerCertificateMetadata'] :: ServerCertificateMetadata -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerCertificateMetadata</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadDate:ServerCertificateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificateMetadata_uploadDate</a> - The date when the server
--   certificate was uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expiration:ServerCertificateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificateMetadata_expiration</a> - The date on which the
--   certificate is set to expire.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:ServerCertificateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificateMetadata_path</a> - The path to the server
--   certificate. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverCertificateName:ServerCertificateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificateMetadata_serverCertificateName</a> - The name that
--   identifies the server certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverCertificateId:ServerCertificateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificateMetadata_serverCertificateId</a> - The stable and
--   unique string identifying the server certificate. For more information
--   about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:ServerCertificateMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificateMetadata_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   specifying the server certificate. For more information about ARNs and
--   how to use them in policies, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
newServerCertificateMetadata :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ServerCertificateMetadata

-- | The date when the server certificate was uploaded.
serverCertificateMetadata_uploadDate :: Lens' ServerCertificateMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The date on which the certificate is set to expire.
serverCertificateMetadata_expiration :: Lens' ServerCertificateMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The path to the server certificate. For more information about paths,
--   see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
serverCertificateMetadata_path :: Lens' ServerCertificateMetadata Text

-- | The name that identifies the server certificate.
serverCertificateMetadata_serverCertificateName :: Lens' ServerCertificateMetadata Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the server certificate. For
--   more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
serverCertificateMetadata_serverCertificateId :: Lens' ServerCertificateMetadata Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the server certificate. For
--   more information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
serverCertificateMetadata_arn :: Lens' ServerCertificateMetadata Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificateMetadata.ServerCertificateMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificateMetadata.ServerCertificateMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificateMetadata.ServerCertificateMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificateMetadata.ServerCertificateMetadata
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificateMetadata.ServerCertificateMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificateMetadata.ServerCertificateMetadata

module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement

-- | Contains a reference to a <tt>Statement</tt> element in a policy
--   document that determines the result of the simulation.
--   
--   This data type is used by the <tt>MatchedStatements</tt> member of the
--   <tt> EvaluationResult </tt> type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newStatement</a> smart constructor.
data Statement
Statement' :: Maybe Position -> Maybe PolicySourceType -> Maybe Position -> Maybe Text -> Statement

-- | The row and column of the beginning of the <tt>Statement</tt> in an
--   IAM policy.
[$sel:startPosition:Statement'] :: Statement -> Maybe Position

-- | The type of the policy.
[$sel:sourcePolicyType:Statement'] :: Statement -> Maybe PolicySourceType

-- | The row and column of the end of a <tt>Statement</tt> in an IAM
--   policy.
[$sel:endPosition:Statement'] :: Statement -> Maybe Position

-- | The identifier of the policy that was provided as an input.
[$sel:sourcePolicyId:Statement'] :: Statement -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Statement</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:startPosition:Statement'</a>, <a>statement_startPosition</a> -
--   The row and column of the beginning of the <tt>Statement</tt> in an
--   IAM policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourcePolicyType:Statement'</a>,
--   <a>statement_sourcePolicyType</a> - The type of the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:endPosition:Statement'</a>, <a>statement_endPosition</a> - The
--   row and column of the end of a <tt>Statement</tt> in an IAM policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sourcePolicyId:Statement'</a>, <a>statement_sourcePolicyId</a>
--   - The identifier of the policy that was provided as an input.
newStatement :: Statement

-- | The row and column of the beginning of the <tt>Statement</tt> in an
--   IAM policy.
statement_startPosition :: Lens' Statement (Maybe Position)

-- | The type of the policy.
statement_sourcePolicyType :: Lens' Statement (Maybe PolicySourceType)

-- | The row and column of the end of a <tt>Statement</tt> in an IAM
--   policy.
statement_endPosition :: Lens' Statement (Maybe Position)

-- | The identifier of the policy that was provided as an input.
statement_sourcePolicyId :: Lens' Statement (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement.Statement
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement.Statement
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement.Statement
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement.Statement
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement.Statement
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement.Statement
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Statement.Statement


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult

-- | Contains the result of the simulation of a single API operation call
--   on a single resource.
--   
--   This data type is used by a member of the EvaluationResult data type.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newResourceSpecificResult</a> smart constructor.
data ResourceSpecificResult
ResourceSpecificResult' :: Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType) -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail -> Maybe [Statement] -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType -> ResourceSpecificResult

-- | Additional details about the results of the evaluation decision on a
--   single resource. This parameter is returned only for cross-account
--   simulations. This parameter explains how each policy type contributes
--   to the resource-specific evaluation decision.
[$sel:evalDecisionDetails:ResourceSpecificResult'] :: ResourceSpecificResult -> Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType)

-- | Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when that boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail:ResourceSpecificResult'] :: ResourceSpecificResult -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail

-- | A list of the statements in the input policies that determine the
--   result for this part of the simulation. Remember that even if multiple
--   statements allow the operation on the resource, if <i>any</i>
--   statement denies that operation, then the explicit deny overrides any
--   allow. In addition, the deny statement is the only entry included in
--   the result.
[$sel:matchedStatements:ResourceSpecificResult'] :: ResourceSpecificResult -> Maybe [Statement]

-- | A list of context keys that are required by the included input
--   policies but that were not provided by one of the input parameters.
--   This list is used when a list of ARNs is included in the
--   <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter instead of "*". If you do not specify
--   individual resources, by setting <tt>ResourceArns</tt> to "*" or by
--   not including the <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter, then any missing
--   context values are instead included under the
--   <tt>EvaluationResults</tt> section. To discover the context keys used
--   by a set of policies, you can call GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or
--   GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
[$sel:missingContextValues:ResourceSpecificResult'] :: ResourceSpecificResult -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the simulated resource, in Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   format.
[$sel:evalResourceName:ResourceSpecificResult'] :: ResourceSpecificResult -> Text

-- | The result of the simulation of the simulated API operation on the
--   resource specified in <tt>EvalResourceName</tt>.
[$sel:evalResourceDecision:ResourceSpecificResult'] :: ResourceSpecificResult -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType

-- | Create a value of <a>ResourceSpecificResult</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalDecisionDetails:ResourceSpecificResult'</a>,
--   <a>resourceSpecificResult_evalDecisionDetails</a> - Additional details
--   about the results of the evaluation decision on a single resource.
--   This parameter is returned only for cross-account simulations. This
--   parameter explains how each policy type contributes to the
--   resource-specific evaluation decision.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail:ResourceSpecificResult'</a>,
--   <a>resourceSpecificResult_permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail</a> -
--   Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when that boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchedStatements:ResourceSpecificResult'</a>,
--   <a>resourceSpecificResult_matchedStatements</a> - A list of the
--   statements in the input policies that determine the result for this
--   part of the simulation. Remember that even if multiple statements
--   allow the operation on the resource, if <i>any</i> statement denies
--   that operation, then the explicit deny overrides any allow. In
--   addition, the deny statement is the only entry included in the result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingContextValues:ResourceSpecificResult'</a>,
--   <a>resourceSpecificResult_missingContextValues</a> - A list of context
--   keys that are required by the included input policies but that were
--   not provided by one of the input parameters. This list is used when a
--   list of ARNs is included in the <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter
--   instead of "*". If you do not specify individual resources, by setting
--   <tt>ResourceArns</tt> to "*" or by not including the
--   <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter, then any missing context values are
--   instead included under the <tt>EvaluationResults</tt> section. To
--   discover the context keys used by a set of policies, you can call
--   GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalResourceName:ResourceSpecificResult'</a>,
--   <a>resourceSpecificResult_evalResourceName</a> - The name of the
--   simulated resource, in Amazon Resource Name (ARN) format.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalResourceDecision:ResourceSpecificResult'</a>,
--   <a>resourceSpecificResult_evalResourceDecision</a> - The result of the
--   simulation of the simulated API operation on the resource specified in
--   <tt>EvalResourceName</tt>.
newResourceSpecificResult :: Text -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType -> ResourceSpecificResult

-- | Additional details about the results of the evaluation decision on a
--   single resource. This parameter is returned only for cross-account
--   simulations. This parameter explains how each policy type contributes
--   to the resource-specific evaluation decision.
resourceSpecificResult_evalDecisionDetails :: Lens' ResourceSpecificResult (Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType))

-- | Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when that boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
resourceSpecificResult_permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail :: Lens' ResourceSpecificResult (Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail)

-- | A list of the statements in the input policies that determine the
--   result for this part of the simulation. Remember that even if multiple
--   statements allow the operation on the resource, if <i>any</i>
--   statement denies that operation, then the explicit deny overrides any
--   allow. In addition, the deny statement is the only entry included in
--   the result.
resourceSpecificResult_matchedStatements :: Lens' ResourceSpecificResult (Maybe [Statement])

-- | A list of context keys that are required by the included input
--   policies but that were not provided by one of the input parameters.
--   This list is used when a list of ARNs is included in the
--   <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter instead of "*". If you do not specify
--   individual resources, by setting <tt>ResourceArns</tt> to "*" or by
--   not including the <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter, then any missing
--   context values are instead included under the
--   <tt>EvaluationResults</tt> section. To discover the context keys used
--   by a set of policies, you can call GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or
--   GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
resourceSpecificResult_missingContextValues :: Lens' ResourceSpecificResult (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the simulated resource, in Amazon Resource Name (ARN)
--   format.
resourceSpecificResult_evalResourceName :: Lens' ResourceSpecificResult Text

-- | The result of the simulation of the simulated API operation on the
--   resource specified in <tt>EvalResourceName</tt>.
resourceSpecificResult_evalResourceDecision :: Lens' ResourceSpecificResult PolicyEvaluationDecisionType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult.ResourceSpecificResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult.ResourceSpecificResult
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult.ResourceSpecificResult
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult.ResourceSpecificResult
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult.ResourceSpecificResult
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult.ResourceSpecificResult
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ResourceSpecificResult.ResourceSpecificResult


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult

-- | Contains the results of a simulation.
--   
--   This data type is used by the return parameter of <tt>
--   SimulateCustomPolicy </tt> and <tt> SimulatePrincipalPolicy </tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvaluationResult</a> smart constructor.
data EvaluationResult
EvaluationResult' :: Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType) -> Maybe OrganizationsDecisionDetail -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail -> Maybe [ResourceSpecificResult] -> Maybe [Statement] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType -> EvaluationResult

-- | Additional details about the results of the cross-account evaluation
--   decision. This parameter is populated for only cross-account
--   simulations. It contains a brief summary of how each policy type
--   contributes to the final evaluation decision.
--   
--   If the simulation evaluates policies within the same account and
--   includes a resource ARN, then the parameter is present but the
--   response is empty. If the simulation evaluates policies within the
--   same account and specifies all resources (<tt>*</tt>), then the
--   parameter is not returned.
--   
--   When you make a cross-account request, Amazon Web Services evaluates
--   the request in the trusting account and the trusted account. The
--   request is allowed only if both evaluations return <tt>true</tt>. For
--   more information about how policies are evaluated, see <a>Evaluating
--   policies within a single account</a>.
--   
--   If an Organizations SCP included in the evaluation denies access, the
--   simulation ends. In this case, policy evaluation does not proceed any
--   further and this parameter is not returned.
[$sel:evalDecisionDetails:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType)

-- | A structure that details how Organizations and its service control
--   policies affect the results of the simulation. Only applies if the
--   simulated user's account is part of an organization.
[$sel:organizationsDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe OrganizationsDecisionDetail

-- | Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when the boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail

-- | The individual results of the simulation of the API operation
--   specified in EvalActionName on each resource.
[$sel:resourceSpecificResults:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe [ResourceSpecificResult]

-- | A list of the statements in the input policies that determine the
--   result for this scenario. Remember that even if multiple statements
--   allow the operation on the resource, if only one statement denies that
--   operation, then the explicit deny overrides any allow. In addition,
--   the deny statement is the only entry included in the result.
[$sel:matchedStatements:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe [Statement]

-- | The ARN of the resource that the indicated API operation was tested
--   on.
[$sel:evalResourceName:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of context keys that are required by the included input
--   policies but that were not provided by one of the input parameters.
--   This list is used when the resource in a simulation is "*", either
--   explicitly, or when the <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter blank. If you
--   include a list of resources, then any missing context values are
--   instead included under the <tt>ResourceSpecificResults</tt> section.
--   To discover the context keys used by a set of policies, you can call
--   GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
[$sel:missingContextValues:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the API operation tested on the indicated resource.
[$sel:evalActionName:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Text

-- | The result of the simulation.
[$sel:evalDecision:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType

-- | Create a value of <a>EvaluationResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalDecisionDetails:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalDecisionDetails</a> - Additional details about
--   the results of the cross-account evaluation decision. This parameter
--   is populated for only cross-account simulations. It contains a brief
--   summary of how each policy type contributes to the final evaluation
--   decision.
--   
--   If the simulation evaluates policies within the same account and
--   includes a resource ARN, then the parameter is present but the
--   response is empty. If the simulation evaluates policies within the
--   same account and specifies all resources (<tt>*</tt>), then the
--   parameter is not returned.
--   
--   When you make a cross-account request, Amazon Web Services evaluates
--   the request in the trusting account and the trusted account. The
--   request is allowed only if both evaluations return <tt>true</tt>. For
--   more information about how policies are evaluated, see <a>Evaluating
--   policies within a single account</a>.
--   
--   If an Organizations SCP included in the evaluation denies access, the
--   simulation ends. In this case, policy evaluation does not proceed any
--   further and this parameter is not returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationsDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_organizationsDecisionDetail</a> - A structure that
--   details how Organizations and its service control policies affect the
--   results of the simulation. Only applies if the simulated user's
--   account is part of an organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail</a> - Contains
--   information about the effect that a permissions boundary has on a
--   policy simulation when the boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceSpecificResults:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_resourceSpecificResults</a> - The individual
--   results of the simulation of the API operation specified in
--   EvalActionName on each resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchedStatements:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_matchedStatements</a> - A list of the statements
--   in the input policies that determine the result for this scenario.
--   Remember that even if multiple statements allow the operation on the
--   resource, if only one statement denies that operation, then the
--   explicit deny overrides any allow. In addition, the deny statement is
--   the only entry included in the result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalResourceName:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalResourceName</a> - The ARN of the resource
--   that the indicated API operation was tested on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingContextValues:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_missingContextValues</a> - A list of context keys
--   that are required by the included input policies but that were not
--   provided by one of the input parameters. This list is used when the
--   resource in a simulation is "*", either explicitly, or when the
--   <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter blank. If you include a list of
--   resources, then any missing context values are instead included under
--   the <tt>ResourceSpecificResults</tt> section. To discover the context
--   keys used by a set of policies, you can call
--   GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalActionName:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalActionName</a> - The name of the API operation
--   tested on the indicated resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalDecision:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalDecision</a> - The result of the simulation.
newEvaluationResult :: Text -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType -> EvaluationResult

-- | Additional details about the results of the cross-account evaluation
--   decision. This parameter is populated for only cross-account
--   simulations. It contains a brief summary of how each policy type
--   contributes to the final evaluation decision.
--   
--   If the simulation evaluates policies within the same account and
--   includes a resource ARN, then the parameter is present but the
--   response is empty. If the simulation evaluates policies within the
--   same account and specifies all resources (<tt>*</tt>), then the
--   parameter is not returned.
--   
--   When you make a cross-account request, Amazon Web Services evaluates
--   the request in the trusting account and the trusted account. The
--   request is allowed only if both evaluations return <tt>true</tt>. For
--   more information about how policies are evaluated, see <a>Evaluating
--   policies within a single account</a>.
--   
--   If an Organizations SCP included in the evaluation denies access, the
--   simulation ends. In this case, policy evaluation does not proceed any
--   further and this parameter is not returned.
evaluationResult_evalDecisionDetails :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType))

-- | A structure that details how Organizations and its service control
--   policies affect the results of the simulation. Only applies if the
--   simulated user's account is part of an organization.
evaluationResult_organizationsDecisionDetail :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe OrganizationsDecisionDetail)

-- | Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when the boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
evaluationResult_permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail)

-- | The individual results of the simulation of the API operation
--   specified in EvalActionName on each resource.
evaluationResult_resourceSpecificResults :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe [ResourceSpecificResult])

-- | A list of the statements in the input policies that determine the
--   result for this scenario. Remember that even if multiple statements
--   allow the operation on the resource, if only one statement denies that
--   operation, then the explicit deny overrides any allow. In addition,
--   the deny statement is the only entry included in the result.
evaluationResult_matchedStatements :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe [Statement])

-- | The ARN of the resource that the indicated API operation was tested
--   on.
evaluationResult_evalResourceName :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of context keys that are required by the included input
--   policies but that were not provided by one of the input parameters.
--   This list is used when the resource in a simulation is "*", either
--   explicitly, or when the <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter blank. If you
--   include a list of resources, then any missing context values are
--   instead included under the <tt>ResourceSpecificResults</tt> section.
--   To discover the context keys used by a set of policies, you can call
--   GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
evaluationResult_missingContextValues :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the API operation tested on the indicated resource.
evaluationResult_evalActionName :: Lens' EvaluationResult Text

-- | The result of the simulation.
evaluationResult_evalDecision :: Lens' EvaluationResult PolicyEvaluationDecisionType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.EvaluationResult.EvaluationResult


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse

-- | Contains the response to a successful SimulatePrincipalPolicy or
--   SimulateCustomPolicy request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSimulatePolicyResponse</a> smart constructor.
data SimulatePolicyResponse
SimulatePolicyResponse' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe [EvaluationResult] -> Maybe Text -> SimulatePolicyResponse

-- | A flag that indicates whether there are more items to return. If your
--   results were truncated, you can make a subsequent pagination request
--   using the <tt>Marker</tt> request parameter to retrieve more items.
--   Note that IAM might return fewer than the <tt>MaxItems</tt> number of
--   results even when there are more results available. We recommend that
--   you check <tt>IsTruncated</tt> after every call to ensure that you
--   receive all your results.
[$sel:isTruncated:SimulatePolicyResponse'] :: SimulatePolicyResponse -> Maybe Bool

-- | The results of the simulation.
[$sel:evaluationResults:SimulatePolicyResponse'] :: SimulatePolicyResponse -> Maybe [EvaluationResult]

-- | When <tt>IsTruncated</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, this element is present
--   and contains the value to use for the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter in a
--   subsequent pagination request.
[$sel:marker:SimulatePolicyResponse'] :: SimulatePolicyResponse -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>SimulatePolicyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:isTruncated:SimulatePolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>simulatePolicyResponse_isTruncated</a> - A flag that indicates
--   whether there are more items to return. If your results were
--   truncated, you can make a subsequent pagination request using the
--   <tt>Marker</tt> request parameter to retrieve more items. Note that
--   IAM might return fewer than the <tt>MaxItems</tt> number of results
--   even when there are more results available. We recommend that you
--   check <tt>IsTruncated</tt> after every call to ensure that you receive
--   all your results.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evaluationResults:SimulatePolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>simulatePolicyResponse_evaluationResults</a> - The results of the
--   simulation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:marker:SimulatePolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>simulatePolicyResponse_marker</a> - When <tt>IsTruncated</tt> is
--   <tt>true</tt>, this element is present and contains the value to use
--   for the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter in a subsequent pagination request.
newSimulatePolicyResponse :: SimulatePolicyResponse

-- | A flag that indicates whether there are more items to return. If your
--   results were truncated, you can make a subsequent pagination request
--   using the <tt>Marker</tt> request parameter to retrieve more items.
--   Note that IAM might return fewer than the <tt>MaxItems</tt> number of
--   results even when there are more results available. We recommend that
--   you check <tt>IsTruncated</tt> after every call to ensure that you
--   receive all your results.
simulatePolicyResponse_isTruncated :: Lens' SimulatePolicyResponse (Maybe Bool)

-- | The results of the simulation.
simulatePolicyResponse_evaluationResults :: Lens' SimulatePolicyResponse (Maybe [EvaluationResult])

-- | When <tt>IsTruncated</tt> is <tt>true</tt>, this element is present
--   and contains the value to use for the <tt>Marker</tt> parameter in a
--   subsequent pagination request.
simulatePolicyResponse_marker :: Lens' SimulatePolicyResponse (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse.SimulatePolicyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse.SimulatePolicyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse.SimulatePolicyResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse.SimulatePolicyResponse
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse.SimulatePolicyResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse.SimulatePolicyResponse
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SimulatePolicyResponse.SimulatePolicyResponse


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.StatusType

StatusType' :: Text -> StatusType
[fromStatusType] :: StatusType -> Text
pattern StatusType_Active :: StatusType
pattern StatusType_Inactive :: StatusType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.StatusType.StatusType

instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IAM.Types.StatusType.StatusType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IAM.Types.StatusType.StatusType

module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate

-- | Contains information about an X.509 signing certificate.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   UploadSigningCertificate and ListSigningCertificates operations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSigningCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data SigningCertificate
SigningCertificate' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StatusType -> SigningCertificate

-- | The date when the signing certificate was uploaded.
[$sel:uploadDate:SigningCertificate'] :: SigningCertificate -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the user the signing certificate is associated with.
[$sel:userName:SigningCertificate'] :: SigningCertificate -> Text

-- | The ID for the signing certificate.
[$sel:certificateId:SigningCertificate'] :: SigningCertificate -> Text

-- | The contents of the signing certificate.
[$sel:certificateBody:SigningCertificate'] :: SigningCertificate -> Text

-- | The status of the signing certificate. <tt>Active</tt> means that the
--   key is valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
[$sel:status:SigningCertificate'] :: SigningCertificate -> StatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>SigningCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadDate:SigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>signingCertificate_uploadDate</a> - The date when the signing
--   certificate was uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:SigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>signingCertificate_userName</a> - The name of the user the signing
--   certificate is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:SigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>signingCertificate_certificateId</a> - The ID for the signing
--   certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateBody:SigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>signingCertificate_certificateBody</a> - The contents of the
--   signing certificate.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:SigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>signingCertificate_status</a> - The status of the signing
--   certificate. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid for API
--   calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
newSigningCertificate :: Text -> Text -> Text -> StatusType -> SigningCertificate

-- | The date when the signing certificate was uploaded.
signingCertificate_uploadDate :: Lens' SigningCertificate (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the user the signing certificate is associated with.
signingCertificate_userName :: Lens' SigningCertificate Text

-- | The ID for the signing certificate.
signingCertificate_certificateId :: Lens' SigningCertificate Text

-- | The contents of the signing certificate.
signingCertificate_certificateBody :: Lens' SigningCertificate Text

-- | The status of the signing certificate. <tt>Active</tt> means that the
--   key is valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
signingCertificate_status :: Lens' SigningCertificate StatusType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate.SigningCertificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate.SigningCertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate.SigningCertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate.SigningCertificate
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate.SigningCertificate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate.SigningCertificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SigningCertificate.SigningCertificate


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata

-- | Contains additional details about a service-specific credential.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata</a> smart
--   constructor.
data ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata
ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata' :: Text -> StatusType -> Text -> ISO8601 -> Text -> Text -> ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
[$sel:userName:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'] :: ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata -> Text

-- | The status of the service-specific credential. <tt>Active</tt> means
--   that the key is valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it
--   is not.
[$sel:status:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'] :: ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata -> StatusType

-- | The generated user name for the service-specific credential.
[$sel:serviceUserName:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'] :: ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata -> Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   service-specific credential were created.
[$sel:createDate:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'] :: ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata -> ISO8601

-- | The unique identifier for the service-specific credential.
[$sel:serviceSpecificCredentialId:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'] :: ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata -> Text

-- | The name of the service associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
[$sel:serviceName:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'] :: ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_userName</a> - The name of the
--   IAM user associated with the service-specific credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_status</a> - The status of the
--   service-specific credential. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceUserName:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_serviceUserName</a> - The
--   generated user name for the service-specific credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_createDate</a> - The date and
--   time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the service-specific
--   credential were created.
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceSpecificCredentialId:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_serviceSpecificCredentialId</a> -
--   The unique identifier for the service-specific credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_serviceName</a> - The name of the
--   service associated with the service-specific credential.
newServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata :: Text -> StatusType -> Text -> UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_userName :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata Text

-- | The status of the service-specific credential. <tt>Active</tt> means
--   that the key is valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it
--   is not.
serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_status :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata StatusType

-- | The generated user name for the service-specific credential.
serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_serviceUserName :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   service-specific credential were created.
serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_createDate :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata UTCTime

-- | The unique identifier for the service-specific credential.
serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_serviceSpecificCredentialId :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata Text

-- | The name of the service associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
serviceSpecificCredentialMetadata_serviceName :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata.ServiceSpecificCredentialMetadata

module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredential

-- | Contains the details of a service-specific credential.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceSpecificCredential</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceSpecificCredential
ServiceSpecificCredential' :: ISO8601 -> Text -> Text -> Sensitive Text -> Text -> Text -> StatusType -> ServiceSpecificCredential

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   service-specific credential were created.
[$sel:createDate:ServiceSpecificCredential'] :: ServiceSpecificCredential -> ISO8601

-- | The name of the service associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
[$sel:serviceName:ServiceSpecificCredential'] :: ServiceSpecificCredential -> Text

-- | The generated user name for the service-specific credential. This
--   value is generated by combining the IAM user's name combined with the
--   ID number of the Amazon Web Services account, as in
--   <tt>jane-at-123456789012</tt>, for example. This value cannot be
--   configured by the user.
[$sel:serviceUserName:ServiceSpecificCredential'] :: ServiceSpecificCredential -> Text

-- | The generated password for the service-specific credential.
[$sel:servicePassword:ServiceSpecificCredential'] :: ServiceSpecificCredential -> Sensitive Text

-- | The unique identifier for the service-specific credential.
[$sel:serviceSpecificCredentialId:ServiceSpecificCredential'] :: ServiceSpecificCredential -> Text

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
[$sel:userName:ServiceSpecificCredential'] :: ServiceSpecificCredential -> Text

-- | The status of the service-specific credential. <tt>Active</tt> means
--   that the key is valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it
--   is not.
[$sel:status:ServiceSpecificCredential'] :: ServiceSpecificCredential -> StatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceSpecificCredential</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:ServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredential_createDate</a> - The date and time, in
--   <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the service-specific credential
--   were created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:ServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredential_serviceName</a> - The name of the service
--   associated with the service-specific credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceUserName:ServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredential_serviceUserName</a> - The generated user
--   name for the service-specific credential. This value is generated by
--   combining the IAM user's name combined with the ID number of the
--   Amazon Web Services account, as in <tt>jane-at-123456789012</tt>, for
--   example. This value cannot be configured by the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:servicePassword:ServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredential_servicePassword</a> - The generated
--   password for the service-specific credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceSpecificCredentialId:ServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredential_serviceSpecificCredentialId</a> - The
--   unique identifier for the service-specific credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:ServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredential_userName</a> - The name of the IAM user
--   associated with the service-specific credential.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:ServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>serviceSpecificCredential_status</a> - The status of the
--   service-specific credential. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
newServiceSpecificCredential :: UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StatusType -> ServiceSpecificCredential

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   service-specific credential were created.
serviceSpecificCredential_createDate :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredential UTCTime

-- | The name of the service associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
serviceSpecificCredential_serviceName :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredential Text

-- | The generated user name for the service-specific credential. This
--   value is generated by combining the IAM user's name combined with the
--   ID number of the Amazon Web Services account, as in
--   <tt>jane-at-123456789012</tt>, for example. This value cannot be
--   configured by the user.
serviceSpecificCredential_serviceUserName :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredential Text

-- | The generated password for the service-specific credential.
serviceSpecificCredential_servicePassword :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredential Text

-- | The unique identifier for the service-specific credential.
serviceSpecificCredential_serviceSpecificCredentialId :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredential Text

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the service-specific
--   credential.
serviceSpecificCredential_userName :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredential Text

-- | The status of the service-specific credential. <tt>Active</tt> means
--   that the key is valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it
--   is not.
serviceSpecificCredential_status :: Lens' ServiceSpecificCredential StatusType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredential.ServiceSpecificCredential
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredential.ServiceSpecificCredential
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredential.ServiceSpecificCredential
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredential.ServiceSpecificCredential
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredential.ServiceSpecificCredential
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceSpecificCredential.ServiceSpecificCredential


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata

-- | Contains information about an SSH public key, without the key's body
--   or fingerprint.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the ListSSHPublicKeys
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSSHPublicKeyMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data SSHPublicKeyMetadata
SSHPublicKeyMetadata' :: Text -> Text -> StatusType -> ISO8601 -> SSHPublicKeyMetadata

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the SSH public key.
[$sel:userName:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'] :: SSHPublicKeyMetadata -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the SSH public key.
[$sel:sSHPublicKeyId:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'] :: SSHPublicKeyMetadata -> Text

-- | The status of the SSH public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key
--   can be used for authentication with an CodeCommit repository.
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot be used.
[$sel:status:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'] :: SSHPublicKeyMetadata -> StatusType

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the SSH
--   public key was uploaded.
[$sel:uploadDate:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'] :: SSHPublicKeyMetadata -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>SSHPublicKeyMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>sSHPublicKeyMetadata_userName</a> - The name of the IAM user
--   associated with the SSH public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSHPublicKeyId:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>sSHPublicKeyMetadata_sSHPublicKeyId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the SSH public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>sSHPublicKeyMetadata_status</a> - The status of the SSH public key.
--   <tt>Active</tt> means that the key can be used for authentication with
--   an CodeCommit repository. <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot
--   be used.
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadDate:SSHPublicKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>sSHPublicKeyMetadata_uploadDate</a> - The date and time, in <a>ISO
--   8601 date-time format</a>, when the SSH public key was uploaded.
newSSHPublicKeyMetadata :: Text -> Text -> StatusType -> UTCTime -> SSHPublicKeyMetadata

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the SSH public key.
sSHPublicKeyMetadata_userName :: Lens' SSHPublicKeyMetadata Text

-- | The unique identifier for the SSH public key.
sSHPublicKeyMetadata_sSHPublicKeyId :: Lens' SSHPublicKeyMetadata Text

-- | The status of the SSH public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key
--   can be used for authentication with an CodeCommit repository.
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot be used.
sSHPublicKeyMetadata_status :: Lens' SSHPublicKeyMetadata StatusType

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the SSH
--   public key was uploaded.
sSHPublicKeyMetadata_uploadDate :: Lens' SSHPublicKeyMetadata UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata.SSHPublicKeyMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata.SSHPublicKeyMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata.SSHPublicKeyMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata.SSHPublicKeyMetadata
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata.SSHPublicKeyMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata.SSHPublicKeyMetadata
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKeyMetadata.SSHPublicKeyMetadata


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKey

-- | Contains information about an SSH public key.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the GetSSHPublicKey
--   and UploadSSHPublicKey operations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newSSHPublicKey</a> smart constructor.
data SSHPublicKey
SSHPublicKey' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StatusType -> SSHPublicKey

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the SSH
--   public key was uploaded.
[$sel:uploadDate:SSHPublicKey'] :: SSHPublicKey -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the SSH public key.
[$sel:userName:SSHPublicKey'] :: SSHPublicKey -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the SSH public key.
[$sel:sSHPublicKeyId:SSHPublicKey'] :: SSHPublicKey -> Text

-- | The MD5 message digest of the SSH public key.
[$sel:fingerprint:SSHPublicKey'] :: SSHPublicKey -> Text

-- | The SSH public key.
[$sel:sSHPublicKeyBody:SSHPublicKey'] :: SSHPublicKey -> Text

-- | The status of the SSH public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key
--   can be used for authentication with an CodeCommit repository.
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot be used.
[$sel:status:SSHPublicKey'] :: SSHPublicKey -> StatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>SSHPublicKey</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:uploadDate:SSHPublicKey'</a>, <a>sSHPublicKey_uploadDate</a> -
--   The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the SSH
--   public key was uploaded.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:SSHPublicKey'</a>, <a>sSHPublicKey_userName</a> - The
--   name of the IAM user associated with the SSH public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSHPublicKeyId:SSHPublicKey'</a>,
--   <a>sSHPublicKey_sSHPublicKeyId</a> - The unique identifier for the SSH
--   public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:fingerprint:SSHPublicKey'</a>, <a>sSHPublicKey_fingerprint</a>
--   - The MD5 message digest of the SSH public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSHPublicKeyBody:SSHPublicKey'</a>,
--   <a>sSHPublicKey_sSHPublicKeyBody</a> - The SSH public key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:SSHPublicKey'</a>, <a>sSHPublicKey_status</a> - The
--   status of the SSH public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key can
--   be used for authentication with an CodeCommit repository.
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot be used.
newSSHPublicKey :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> StatusType -> SSHPublicKey

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the SSH
--   public key was uploaded.
sSHPublicKey_uploadDate :: Lens' SSHPublicKey (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the SSH public key.
sSHPublicKey_userName :: Lens' SSHPublicKey Text

-- | The unique identifier for the SSH public key.
sSHPublicKey_sSHPublicKeyId :: Lens' SSHPublicKey Text

-- | The MD5 message digest of the SSH public key.
sSHPublicKey_fingerprint :: Lens' SSHPublicKey Text

-- | The SSH public key.
sSHPublicKey_sSHPublicKeyBody :: Lens' SSHPublicKey Text

-- | The status of the SSH public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key
--   can be used for authentication with an CodeCommit repository.
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot be used.
sSHPublicKey_status :: Lens' SSHPublicKey StatusType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKey.SSHPublicKey
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKey.SSHPublicKey
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SSHPublicKey.SSHPublicKey

module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata

-- | Contains information about an Amazon Web Services access key, without
--   its secret key.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the ListAccessKeys
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKeyMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKeyMetadata
AccessKeyMetadata' :: Maybe StatusType -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessKey -> AccessKeyMetadata

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls; <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
[$sel:status:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe StatusType

-- | The date when the access key was created.
[$sel:createDate:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the IAM user that the key is associated with.
[$sel:userName:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID for this access key.
[$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe AccessKey

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKeyMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>, <a>accessKeyMetadata_status</a>
--   - The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls; <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyMetadata_createDate</a> - The date when the access key was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyMetadata_userName</a> - The name of the IAM user that the
--   key is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyMetadata_accessKeyId</a> - The ID for this access key.
newAccessKeyMetadata :: AccessKeyMetadata

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls; <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
accessKeyMetadata_status :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe StatusType)

-- | The date when the access key was created.
accessKeyMetadata_createDate :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM user that the key is associated with.
accessKeyMetadata_userName :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID for this access key.
accessKeyMetadata_accessKeyId :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe AccessKey)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata.AccessKeyMetadata
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata.AccessKeyMetadata
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata.AccessKeyMetadata
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata.AccessKeyMetadata
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata.AccessKeyMetadata
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata.AccessKeyMetadata
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyMetadata.AccessKeyMetadata


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyInfo

-- | Contains information about an Amazon Web Services access key.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the CreateAccessKey
--   and ListAccessKeys operations.
--   
--   The <tt>SecretAccessKey</tt> value is returned only in response to
--   CreateAccessKey. You can get a secret access key only when you first
--   create an access key; you cannot recover the secret access key later.
--   If you lose a secret access key, you must create a new access key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKeyInfo</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKeyInfo
AccessKeyInfo' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> AccessKey -> StatusType -> Sensitive Text -> AccessKeyInfo

-- | The date when the access key was created.
[$sel:createDate:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the IAM user that the access key is associated with.
[$sel:userName:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> Text

-- | The ID for this access key.
[$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
[$sel:status:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> StatusType

-- | The secret key used to sign requests.
[$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKeyInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:AccessKeyInfo'</a>, <a>accessKeyInfo_createDate</a>
--   - The date when the access key was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:AccessKeyInfo'</a>, <a>accessKeyInfo_userName</a> -
--   The name of the IAM user that the access key is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyInfo_accessKeyId</a> - The ID for this access key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccessKeyInfo'</a>, <a>accessKeyInfo_status</a> - The
--   status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid
--   for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKeyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyInfo_secretAccessKey</a> - The secret key used to sign
--   requests.
newAccessKeyInfo :: Text -> AccessKey -> StatusType -> Text -> AccessKeyInfo

-- | The date when the access key was created.
accessKeyInfo_createDate :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM user that the access key is associated with.
accessKeyInfo_userName :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo Text

-- | The ID for this access key.
accessKeyInfo_accessKeyId :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
accessKeyInfo_status :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo StatusType

-- | The secret key used to sign requests.
accessKeyInfo_secretAccessKey :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyInfo.AccessKeyInfo
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyInfo.AccessKeyInfo
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyInfo.AccessKeyInfo
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyInfo.AccessKeyInfo
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyInfo.AccessKeyInfo
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.AccessKeyInfo.AccessKeyInfo


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType
newtype SummaryKeyType
SummaryKeyType' :: Text -> SummaryKeyType
[fromSummaryKeyType] :: SummaryKeyType -> Text
pattern SummaryKeyType_AccessKeysPerUserQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_AccountAccessKeysPresent :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_AccountMFAEnabled :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_AccountSigningCertificatesPresent :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_AttachedPoliciesPerGroupQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_AttachedPoliciesPerRoleQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_AttachedPoliciesPerUserQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_GlobalEndpointTokenVersion :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_GroupPolicySizeQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_Groups :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_GroupsPerUserQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_GroupsQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_MFADevices :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_MFADevicesInUse :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_Policies :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_PoliciesQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_PolicySizeQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_PolicyVersionsInUse :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_PolicyVersionsInUseQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_ServerCertificates :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_ServerCertificatesQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_SigningCertificatesPerUserQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_UserPolicySizeQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_Users :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_UsersQuota :: SummaryKeyType
pattern SummaryKeyType_VersionsPerPolicyQuota :: SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.ToXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSONKey Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.ToJSON.ToJSON Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSONKey Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Data.Aeson.Types.FromJSON.FromJSON Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeader Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Log.ToLog Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.ByteString.ToByteString Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.ToText Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Network.AWS.Data.Text.FromText Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance GHC.Classes.Ord Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.SummaryKeyType.SummaryKeyType


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag

-- | A structure that represents user-provided metadata that can be
--   associated with an IAM resource. For more information about tagging,
--   see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTag</a> smart constructor.
data Tag
Tag' :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key name that can be used to look up or retrieve the associated
--   value. For example, <tt>Department</tt> or <tt>Cost Center</tt> are
--   common choices.
[$sel:key:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | The value associated with this tag. For example, tags with a key name
--   of <tt>Department</tt> could have values such as <tt>Human
--   Resources</tt>, <tt>Accounting</tt>, and <tt>Support</tt>. Tags with a
--   key name of <tt>Cost Center</tt> might have values that consist of the
--   number associated with the different cost centers in your company.
--   Typically, many resources have tags with the same key name but with
--   different values.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services always interprets the tag <tt>Value</tt> as a
--   single string. If you need to store an array, you can store
--   comma-separated values in the string. However, you must interpret the
--   value in your code.
[$sel:value:Tag'] :: Tag -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Tag</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:key:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_key</a> - The key name that can be used
--   to look up or retrieve the associated value. For example,
--   <tt>Department</tt> or <tt>Cost Center</tt> are common choices.
--   
--   <a>$sel:value:Tag'</a>, <a>tag_value</a> - The value associated with
--   this tag. For example, tags with a key name of <tt>Department</tt>
--   could have values such as <tt>Human Resources</tt>,
--   <tt>Accounting</tt>, and <tt>Support</tt>. Tags with a key name of
--   <tt>Cost Center</tt> might have values that consist of the number
--   associated with the different cost centers in your company. Typically,
--   many resources have tags with the same key name but with different
--   values.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services always interprets the tag <tt>Value</tt> as a
--   single string. If you need to store an array, you can store
--   comma-separated values in the string. However, you must interpret the
--   value in your code.
newTag :: Text -> Text -> Tag

-- | The key name that can be used to look up or retrieve the associated
--   value. For example, <tt>Department</tt> or <tt>Cost Center</tt> are
--   common choices.
tag_key :: Lens' Tag Text

-- | The value associated with this tag. For example, tags with a key name
--   of <tt>Department</tt> could have values such as <tt>Human
--   Resources</tt>, <tt>Accounting</tt>, and <tt>Support</tt>. Tags with a
--   key name of <tt>Cost Center</tt> might have values that consist of the
--   number associated with the different cost centers in your company.
--   Typically, many resources have tags with the same key name but with
--   different values.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services always interprets the tag <tt>Value</tt> as a
--   single string. If you need to store an array, you can store
--   comma-separated values in the string. However, you must interpret the
--   value in your code.
tag_value :: Lens' Tag Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Tag.Tag


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate

-- | Contains information about a server certificate.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetServerCertificate operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServerCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data ServerCertificate
ServerCertificate' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> ServerCertificateMetadata -> Text -> ServerCertificate

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the server certificate. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:ServerCertificate'] :: ServerCertificate -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The contents of the public key certificate chain.
[$sel:certificateChain:ServerCertificate'] :: ServerCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The meta information of the server certificate, such as its name,
--   path, ID, and ARN.
[$sel:serverCertificateMetadata:ServerCertificate'] :: ServerCertificate -> ServerCertificateMetadata

-- | The contents of the public key certificate.
[$sel:certificateBody:ServerCertificate'] :: ServerCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServerCertificate</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:ServerCertificate'</a>, <a>serverCertificate_tags</a> - A
--   list of tags that are attached to the server certificate. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateChain:ServerCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificate_certificateChain</a> - The contents of the public
--   key certificate chain.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverCertificateMetadata:ServerCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificate_serverCertificateMetadata</a> - The meta
--   information of the server certificate, such as its name, path, ID, and
--   ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateBody:ServerCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>serverCertificate_certificateBody</a> - The contents of the public
--   key certificate.
newServerCertificate :: ServerCertificateMetadata -> Text -> ServerCertificate

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the server certificate. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
serverCertificate_tags :: Lens' ServerCertificate (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The contents of the public key certificate chain.
serverCertificate_certificateChain :: Lens' ServerCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The meta information of the server certificate, such as its name,
--   path, ID, and ARN.
serverCertificate_serverCertificateMetadata :: Lens' ServerCertificate ServerCertificateMetadata

-- | The contents of the public key certificate.
serverCertificate_certificateBody :: Lens' ServerCertificate Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate.ServerCertificate
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate.ServerCertificate
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate.ServerCertificate
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate.ServerCertificate
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate.ServerCertificate
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate.ServerCertificate
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServerCertificate.ServerCertificate


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role

-- | Contains information about an IAM role. This structure is returned as
--   a response element in several API operations that interact with roles.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRole</a> smart constructor.
data Role
Role' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe RoleLastUsed -> Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> Role

-- | The policy that grants an entity permission to assume the role.
[$sel:assumeRolePolicyDocument:Role'] :: Role -> Maybe Text

-- | The maximum session duration (in seconds) for the specified role.
--   Anyone who uses the CLI, or API to assume the role can specify the
--   duration using the optional <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> API parameter or
--   <tt>duration-seconds</tt> CLI parameter.
[$sel:maxSessionDuration:Role'] :: Role -> Maybe Natural

-- | Contains information about the last time that an IAM role was used.
--   This includes the date and time and the Region in which the role was
--   last used. Activity is only reported for the trailing 400 days. This
--   period can be shorter if your Region began supporting these features
--   within the last year. The role might have been used more than 400 days
--   ago. For more information, see <a>Regions where data is tracked</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:roleLastUsed:Role'] :: Role -> Maybe RoleLastUsed

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   role.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundary:Role'] :: Role -> Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the role. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:Role'] :: Role -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A description of the role that you provide.
[$sel:description:Role'] :: Role -> Maybe Text

-- | The path to the role. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:Role'] :: Role -> Text

-- | The friendly name that identifies the role.
[$sel:roleName:Role'] :: Role -> Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the role. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:roleId:Role'] :: Role -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the role. For more
--   information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i> guide.
[$sel:arn:Role'] :: Role -> Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the role
--   was created.
[$sel:createDate:Role'] :: Role -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>Role</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assumeRolePolicyDocument:Role'</a>,
--   <a>role_assumeRolePolicyDocument</a> - The policy that grants an
--   entity permission to assume the role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSessionDuration:Role'</a>, <a>role_maxSessionDuration</a> -
--   The maximum session duration (in seconds) for the specified role.
--   Anyone who uses the CLI, or API to assume the role can specify the
--   duration using the optional <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> API parameter or
--   <tt>duration-seconds</tt> CLI parameter.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleLastUsed:Role'</a>, <a>role_roleLastUsed</a> - Contains
--   information about the last time that an IAM role was used. This
--   includes the date and time and the Region in which the role was last
--   used. Activity is only reported for the trailing 400 days. This period
--   can be shorter if your Region began supporting these features within
--   the last year. The role might have been used more than 400 days ago.
--   For more information, see <a>Regions where data is tracked</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundary:Role'</a>, <a>role_permissionsBoundary</a>
--   - The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   role.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Role'</a>, <a>role_tags</a> - A list of tags that are
--   attached to the role. For more information about tagging, see
--   <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Role'</a>, <a>role_description</a> - A description
--   of the role that you provide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:Role'</a>, <a>role_path</a> - The path to the role. For
--   more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:Role'</a>, <a>role_roleName</a> - The friendly name
--   that identifies the role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleId:Role'</a>, <a>role_roleId</a> - The stable and unique
--   string identifying the role. For more information about IDs, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Role'</a>, <a>role_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) specifying the role. For more information about ARNs and how to
--   use them in policies, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i> guide.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:Role'</a>, <a>role_createDate</a> - The date and
--   time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the role was created.
