newRole :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> Role

-- | The policy that grants an entity permission to assume the role.
role_assumeRolePolicyDocument :: Lens' Role (Maybe Text)

-- | The maximum session duration (in seconds) for the specified role.
--   Anyone who uses the CLI, or API to assume the role can specify the
--   duration using the optional <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> API parameter or
--   <tt>duration-seconds</tt> CLI parameter.
role_maxSessionDuration :: Lens' Role (Maybe Natural)

-- | Contains information about the last time that an IAM role was used.
--   This includes the date and time and the Region in which the role was
--   last used. Activity is only reported for the trailing 400 days. This
--   period can be shorter if your Region began supporting these features
--   within the last year. The role might have been used more than 400 days
--   ago. For more information, see <a>Regions where data is tracked</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
role_roleLastUsed :: Lens' Role (Maybe RoleLastUsed)

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   role.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
role_permissionsBoundary :: Lens' Role (Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary)

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the role. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
role_tags :: Lens' Role (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A description of the role that you provide.
role_description :: Lens' Role (Maybe Text)

-- | The path to the role. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
role_path :: Lens' Role Text

-- | The friendly name that identifies the role.
role_roleName :: Lens' Role Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the role. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
role_roleId :: Lens' Role Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the role. For more
--   information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i> guide.
role_arn :: Lens' Role Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the role
--   was created.
role_createDate :: Lens' Role UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role.Role
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role.Role
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role.Role
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role.Role
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role.Role
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role.Role
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Role.Role


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy

-- | Contains information about a managed policy.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the CreatePolicy,
--   GetPolicy, and ListPolicies operations.
--   
--   For more information about managed policies, refer to <a>Managed
--   policies and inline policies</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data Policy
Policy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Policy

-- | The friendly name (not ARN) identifying the policy.
[$sel:policyName:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of entities (users and roles) for which the policy is used
--   to set the permissions boundary.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryUsageCount:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether the policy can be attached to an IAM user, group, or
--   role.
[$sel:isAttachable:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was created.
[$sel:createDate:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe ISO8601
[$sel:arn:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of entities (users, groups, and roles) that the policy is
--   attached to.
[$sel:attachmentCount:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Int

-- | The identifier for the version of the policy that is set as the
--   default version.
[$sel:defaultVersionId:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the instance profile. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A friendly description of the policy.
--   
--   This element is included in the response to the GetPolicy operation.
--   It is not included in the response to the ListPolicies operation.
[$sel:description:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was last updated.
--   
--   When a policy has only one version, this field contains the date and
--   time when the policy was created. When a policy has more than one
--   version, this field contains the date and time when the most recent
--   policy version was created.
[$sel:updateDate:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The path to the policy.
--   
--   For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the policy.
--   
--   For more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:policyId:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>Policy</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyName:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyName</a> - The
--   friendly name (not ARN) identifying the policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundaryUsageCount:Policy'</a>,
--   <a>policy_permissionsBoundaryUsageCount</a> - The number of entities
--   (users and roles) for which the policy is used to set the permissions
--   boundary.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:isAttachable:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_isAttachable</a> -
--   Specifies whether the policy can be attached to an IAM user, group, or
--   role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_createDate</a> - The date
--   and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the policy was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_arn</a> - Undocumented member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachmentCount:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_attachmentCount</a> -
--   The number of entities (users, groups, and roles) that the policy is
--   attached to.
--   
--   <a>$sel:defaultVersionId:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_defaultVersionId</a> -
--   The identifier for the version of the policy that is set as the
--   default version.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_tags</a> - A list of tags that are
--   attached to the instance profile. For more information about tagging,
--   see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_description</a> - A
--   friendly description of the policy.
--   
--   This element is included in the response to the GetPolicy operation.
--   It is not included in the response to the ListPolicies operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:updateDate:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_updateDate</a> - The date
--   and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the policy was
--   last updated.
--   
--   When a policy has only one version, this field contains the date and
--   time when the policy was created. When a policy has more than one
--   version, this field contains the date and time when the most recent
--   policy version was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_path</a> - The path to the policy.
--   
--   For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:policyId:Policy'</a>, <a>policy_policyId</a> - The stable and
--   unique string identifying the policy.
--   
--   For more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
newPolicy :: Policy

-- | The friendly name (not ARN) identifying the policy.
policy_policyName :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of entities (users and roles) for which the policy is used
--   to set the permissions boundary.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
policy_permissionsBoundaryUsageCount :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Int)

-- | Specifies whether the policy can be attached to an IAM user, group, or
--   role.
policy_isAttachable :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Bool)

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was created.
policy_createDate :: Lens' Policy (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | Undocumented member.
policy_arn :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | The number of entities (users, groups, and roles) that the policy is
--   attached to.
policy_attachmentCount :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Int)

-- | The identifier for the version of the policy that is set as the
--   default version.
policy_defaultVersionId :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the instance profile. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
policy_tags :: Lens' Policy (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A friendly description of the policy.
--   
--   This element is included in the response to the GetPolicy operation.
--   It is not included in the response to the ListPolicies operation.
policy_description :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was last updated.
--   
--   When a policy has only one version, this field contains the date and
--   time when the policy was created. When a policy has more than one
--   version, this field contains the date and time when the most recent
--   policy version was created.
policy_updateDate :: Lens' Policy (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The path to the policy.
--   
--   For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
policy_path :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the policy.
--   
--   For more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
policy_policyId :: Lens' Policy (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy.Policy
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy.Policy
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.Policy.Policy


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile

-- | Contains information about an instance profile.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateInstanceProfile</li>
--   <li>GetInstanceProfile</li>
--   <li>ListInstanceProfiles</li>
--   <li>ListInstanceProfilesForRole</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newInstanceProfile</a> smart constructor.
data InstanceProfile
InstanceProfile' :: Maybe [Tag] -> Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> [Role] -> InstanceProfile

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the instance profile. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The path to the instance profile. For more information about paths,
--   see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> Text

-- | The name identifying the instance profile.
[$sel:instanceProfileName:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the instance profile. For
--   more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
[$sel:instanceProfileId:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the instance profile. For
--   more information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:arn:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> Text

-- | The date when the instance profile was created.
[$sel:createDate:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> ISO8601

-- | The role associated with the instance profile.
[$sel:roles:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> [Role]

-- | Create a value of <a>InstanceProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:InstanceProfile'</a>, <a>instanceProfile_tags</a> - A
--   list of tags that are attached to the instance profile. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:InstanceProfile'</a>, <a>instanceProfile_path</a> - The
--   path to the instance profile. For more information about paths, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProfileName:InstanceProfile'</a>,
--   <a>instanceProfile_instanceProfileName</a> - The name identifying the
--   instance profile.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProfileId:InstanceProfile'</a>,
--   <a>instanceProfile_instanceProfileId</a> - The stable and unique
--   string identifying the instance profile. For more information about
--   IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:InstanceProfile'</a>, <a>instanceProfile_arn</a> - The
--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the instance profile. For more
--   information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:InstanceProfile'</a>,
--   <a>instanceProfile_createDate</a> - The date when the instance profile
--   was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roles:InstanceProfile'</a>, <a>instanceProfile_roles</a> - The
--   role associated with the instance profile.
newInstanceProfile :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> InstanceProfile

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the instance profile. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
instanceProfile_tags :: Lens' InstanceProfile (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The path to the instance profile. For more information about paths,
--   see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
instanceProfile_path :: Lens' InstanceProfile Text

-- | The name identifying the instance profile.
instanceProfile_instanceProfileName :: Lens' InstanceProfile Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the instance profile. For
--   more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
instanceProfile_instanceProfileId :: Lens' InstanceProfile Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the instance profile. For
--   more information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
instanceProfile_arn :: Lens' InstanceProfile Text

-- | The date when the instance profile was created.
instanceProfile_createDate :: Lens' InstanceProfile UTCTime

-- | The role associated with the instance profile.
instanceProfile_roles :: Lens' InstanceProfile [Role]
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile.InstanceProfile
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile.InstanceProfile
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile.InstanceProfile
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile.InstanceProfile
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile.InstanceProfile
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile.InstanceProfile
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.InstanceProfile.InstanceProfile


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail

-- | Contains information about an IAM role, including all of the role's
--   policies.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetAccountAuthorizationDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newRoleDetail</a> smart constructor.
data RoleDetail
RoleDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe RoleLastUsed -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [AttachedPolicy] -> Maybe [PolicyDetail] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe [InstanceProfile] -> Maybe Text -> RoleDetail

-- | The trust policy that grants permission to assume the role.
[$sel:assumeRolePolicyDocument:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about the last time that an IAM role was used.
--   This includes the date and time and the Region in which the role was
--   last used. Activity is only reported for the trailing 400 days. This
--   period can be shorter if your Region began supporting these features
--   within the last year. The role might have been used more than 400 days
--   ago. For more information, see <a>Regions where data is tracked</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:roleLastUsed:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe RoleLastUsed

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the role. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:roleId:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of managed policies attached to the role. These policies are
--   the role's access (permissions) policies.
[$sel:attachedManagedPolicies:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe [AttachedPolicy]

-- | A list of inline policies embedded in the role. These policies are the
--   role's access (permissions) policies.
[$sel:rolePolicyList:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe [PolicyDetail]

-- | The friendly name that identifies the role.
[$sel:roleName:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the role
--   was created.
[$sel:createDate:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   role.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundary:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary
[$sel:arn:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the role. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A list of instance profiles that contain this role.
[$sel:instanceProfileList:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe [InstanceProfile]

-- | The path to the role. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:RoleDetail'] :: RoleDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>RoleDetail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:assumeRolePolicyDocument:RoleDetail'</a>,
--   <a>roleDetail_assumeRolePolicyDocument</a> - The trust policy that
--   grants permission to assume the role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleLastUsed:RoleDetail'</a>, <a>roleDetail_roleLastUsed</a> -
--   Contains information about the last time that an IAM role was used.
--   This includes the date and time and the Region in which the role was
--   last used. Activity is only reported for the trailing 400 days. This
--   period can be shorter if your Region began supporting these features
--   within the last year. The role might have been used more than 400 days
--   ago. For more information, see <a>Regions where data is tracked</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleId:RoleDetail'</a>, <a>roleDetail_roleId</a> - The stable
--   and unique string identifying the role. For more information about
--   IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachedManagedPolicies:RoleDetail'</a>,
--   <a>roleDetail_attachedManagedPolicies</a> - A list of managed policies
--   attached to the role. These policies are the role's access
--   (permissions) policies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:rolePolicyList:RoleDetail'</a>,
--   <a>roleDetail_rolePolicyList</a> - A list of inline policies embedded
--   in the role. These policies are the role's access (permissions)
--   policies.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:RoleDetail'</a>, <a>roleDetail_roleName</a> - The
--   friendly name that identifies the role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:RoleDetail'</a>, <a>roleDetail_createDate</a> - The
--   date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the role was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundary:RoleDetail'</a>,
--   <a>roleDetail_permissionsBoundary</a> - The ARN of the policy used to
--   set the permissions boundary for the role.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:RoleDetail'</a>, <a>roleDetail_arn</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:RoleDetail'</a>, <a>roleDetail_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   that are attached to the role. For more information about tagging, see
--   <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProfileList:RoleDetail'</a>,
--   <a>roleDetail_instanceProfileList</a> - A list of instance profiles
--   that contain this role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:RoleDetail'</a>, <a>roleDetail_path</a> - The path to the
--   role. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
newRoleDetail :: RoleDetail

-- | The trust policy that grants permission to assume the role.
roleDetail_assumeRolePolicyDocument :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about the last time that an IAM role was used.
--   This includes the date and time and the Region in which the role was
--   last used. Activity is only reported for the trailing 400 days. This
--   period can be shorter if your Region began supporting these features
--   within the last year. The role might have been used more than 400 days
--   ago. For more information, see <a>Regions where data is tracked</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
roleDetail_roleLastUsed :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe RoleLastUsed)

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the role. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
roleDetail_roleId :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of managed policies attached to the role. These policies are
--   the role's access (permissions) policies.
roleDetail_attachedManagedPolicies :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe [AttachedPolicy])

-- | A list of inline policies embedded in the role. These policies are the
--   role's access (permissions) policies.
roleDetail_rolePolicyList :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe [PolicyDetail])

-- | The friendly name that identifies the role.
roleDetail_roleName :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the role
--   was created.
roleDetail_createDate :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   role.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
roleDetail_permissionsBoundary :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary)

-- | Undocumented member.
roleDetail_arn :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the role. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
roleDetail_tags :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe [Tag])

-- | A list of instance profiles that contain this role.
roleDetail_instanceProfileList :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe [InstanceProfile])

-- | The path to the role. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
roleDetail_path :: Lens' RoleDetail (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail.RoleDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail.RoleDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail.RoleDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail.RoleDetail
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail.RoleDetail
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail.RoleDetail
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.RoleDetail.RoleDetail


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed

-- | Contains details about the most recent attempt to access an action
--   within the service.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetServiceLastAccessedDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newTrackedActionLastAccessed</a> smart constructor.
data TrackedActionLastAccessed
TrackedActionLastAccessed' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> TrackedActionLastAccessed

-- | The name of the tracked action to which access was attempted. Tracked
--   actions are actions that report activity to IAM.
[$sel:actionName:TrackedActionLastAccessed'] :: TrackedActionLastAccessed -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an
--   authenticated entity most recently attempted to access the tracked
--   service. Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:lastAccessedTime:TrackedActionLastAccessed'] :: TrackedActionLastAccessed -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The Region from which the authenticated entity (user or role) last
--   attempted to access the tracked action. Amazon Web Services does not
--   report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:lastAccessedRegion:TrackedActionLastAccessed'] :: TrackedActionLastAccessed -> Maybe Text
[$sel:lastAccessedEntity:TrackedActionLastAccessed'] :: TrackedActionLastAccessed -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>TrackedActionLastAccessed</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:actionName:TrackedActionLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>trackedActionLastAccessed_actionName</a> - The name of the tracked
--   action to which access was attempted. Tracked actions are actions that
--   report activity to IAM.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAccessedTime:TrackedActionLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>trackedActionLastAccessed_lastAccessedTime</a> - The date and time,
--   in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an authenticated entity most
--   recently attempted to access the tracked service. Amazon Web Services
--   does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAccessedRegion:TrackedActionLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>trackedActionLastAccessed_lastAccessedRegion</a> - The Region from
--   which the authenticated entity (user or role) last attempted to access
--   the tracked action. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAccessedEntity:TrackedActionLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>trackedActionLastAccessed_lastAccessedEntity</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
newTrackedActionLastAccessed :: TrackedActionLastAccessed

-- | The name of the tracked action to which access was attempted. Tracked
--   actions are actions that report activity to IAM.
trackedActionLastAccessed_actionName :: Lens' TrackedActionLastAccessed (Maybe Text)

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an
--   authenticated entity most recently attempted to access the tracked
--   service. Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
trackedActionLastAccessed_lastAccessedTime :: Lens' TrackedActionLastAccessed (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The Region from which the authenticated entity (user or role) last
--   attempted to access the tracked action. Amazon Web Services does not
--   report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
trackedActionLastAccessed_lastAccessedRegion :: Lens' TrackedActionLastAccessed (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
trackedActionLastAccessed_lastAccessedEntity :: Lens' TrackedActionLastAccessed (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed.TrackedActionLastAccessed
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed.TrackedActionLastAccessed
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed.TrackedActionLastAccessed
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed.TrackedActionLastAccessed
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed.TrackedActionLastAccessed
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed.TrackedActionLastAccessed
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.TrackedActionLastAccessed.TrackedActionLastAccessed


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed

-- | Contains details about the most recent attempt to access the service.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetServiceLastAccessedDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newServiceLastAccessed</a> smart constructor.
data ServiceLastAccessed
ServiceLastAccessed' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [TrackedActionLastAccessed] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> Text -> ServiceLastAccessed

-- | The total number of authenticated principals (root user, IAM users, or
--   IAM roles) that have attempted to access the service.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:totalAuthenticatedEntities:ServiceLastAccessed'] :: ServiceLastAccessed -> Maybe Int

-- | The Region from which the authenticated entity (user or role) last
--   attempted to access the service. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:lastAuthenticatedRegion:ServiceLastAccessed'] :: ServiceLastAccessed -> Maybe Text

-- | The ARN of the authenticated entity (user or role) that last attempted
--   to access the service. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:lastAuthenticatedEntity:ServiceLastAccessed'] :: ServiceLastAccessed -> Maybe Text

-- | An object that contains details about the most recent attempt to
--   access a tracked action within the service.
--   
--   This field is null if there no tracked actions or if the principal did
--   not use the tracked actions within the <a>reporting period</a>. This
--   field is also null if the report was generated at the service level
--   and not the action level. For more information, see the
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> field in GenerateServiceLastAccessedDetails.
[$sel:trackedActionsLastAccessed:ServiceLastAccessed'] :: ServiceLastAccessed -> Maybe [TrackedActionLastAccessed]

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an
--   authenticated entity most recently attempted to access the service.
--   Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:lastAuthenticated:ServiceLastAccessed'] :: ServiceLastAccessed -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the service in which access was attempted.
[$sel:serviceName:ServiceLastAccessed'] :: ServiceLastAccessed -> Text

-- | The namespace of the service in which access was attempted.
--   
--   To learn the service namespace of a service, see <a>Actions,
--   resources, and condition keys for Amazon Web Services services</a> in
--   the <i>Service Authorization Reference</i>. Choose the name of the
--   service to view details for that service. In the first paragraph, find
--   the service prefix. For example, <tt>(service prefix: a4b)</tt>. For
--   more information about service namespaces, see <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Service Namespaces</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:serviceNamespace:ServiceLastAccessed'] :: ServiceLastAccessed -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ServiceLastAccessed</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalAuthenticatedEntities:ServiceLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>serviceLastAccessed_totalAuthenticatedEntities</a> - The total
--   number of authenticated principals (root user, IAM users, or IAM
--   roles) that have attempted to access the service.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAuthenticatedRegion:ServiceLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>serviceLastAccessed_lastAuthenticatedRegion</a> - The Region from
--   which the authenticated entity (user or role) last attempted to access
--   the service. Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated
--   requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAuthenticatedEntity:ServiceLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>serviceLastAccessed_lastAuthenticatedEntity</a> - The ARN of the
--   authenticated entity (user or role) that last attempted to access the
--   service. Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:trackedActionsLastAccessed:ServiceLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>serviceLastAccessed_trackedActionsLastAccessed</a> - An object that
--   contains details about the most recent attempt to access a tracked
--   action within the service.
--   
--   This field is null if there no tracked actions or if the principal did
--   not use the tracked actions within the <a>reporting period</a>. This
--   field is also null if the report was generated at the service level
--   and not the action level. For more information, see the
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> field in GenerateServiceLastAccessedDetails.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAuthenticated:ServiceLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>serviceLastAccessed_lastAuthenticated</a> - The date and time, in
--   <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an authenticated entity most
--   recently attempted to access the service. Amazon Web Services does not
--   report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:ServiceLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>serviceLastAccessed_serviceName</a> - The name of the service in
--   which access was attempted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceNamespace:ServiceLastAccessed'</a>,
--   <a>serviceLastAccessed_serviceNamespace</a> - The namespace of the
--   service in which access was attempted.
--   
--   To learn the service namespace of a service, see <a>Actions,
--   resources, and condition keys for Amazon Web Services services</a> in
--   the <i>Service Authorization Reference</i>. Choose the name of the
--   service to view details for that service. In the first paragraph, find
--   the service prefix. For example, <tt>(service prefix: a4b)</tt>. For
--   more information about service namespaces, see <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Service Namespaces</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
newServiceLastAccessed :: Text -> Text -> ServiceLastAccessed

-- | The total number of authenticated principals (root user, IAM users, or
--   IAM roles) that have attempted to access the service.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
serviceLastAccessed_totalAuthenticatedEntities :: Lens' ServiceLastAccessed (Maybe Int)

-- | The Region from which the authenticated entity (user or role) last
--   attempted to access the service. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
serviceLastAccessed_lastAuthenticatedRegion :: Lens' ServiceLastAccessed (Maybe Text)

-- | The ARN of the authenticated entity (user or role) that last attempted
--   to access the service. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
serviceLastAccessed_lastAuthenticatedEntity :: Lens' ServiceLastAccessed (Maybe Text)

-- | An object that contains details about the most recent attempt to
--   access a tracked action within the service.
--   
--   This field is null if there no tracked actions or if the principal did
--   not use the tracked actions within the <a>reporting period</a>. This
--   field is also null if the report was generated at the service level
--   and not the action level. For more information, see the
--   <tt>Granularity</tt> field in GenerateServiceLastAccessedDetails.
serviceLastAccessed_trackedActionsLastAccessed :: Lens' ServiceLastAccessed (Maybe [TrackedActionLastAccessed])

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an
--   authenticated entity most recently attempted to access the service.
--   Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
serviceLastAccessed_lastAuthenticated :: Lens' ServiceLastAccessed (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the service in which access was attempted.
serviceLastAccessed_serviceName :: Lens' ServiceLastAccessed Text

-- | The namespace of the service in which access was attempted.
--   
--   To learn the service namespace of a service, see <a>Actions,
--   resources, and condition keys for Amazon Web Services services</a> in
--   the <i>Service Authorization Reference</i>. Choose the name of the
--   service to view details for that service. In the first paragraph, find
--   the service prefix. For example, <tt>(service prefix: a4b)</tt>. For
--   more information about service namespaces, see <a>Amazon Web Services
--   Service Namespaces</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
serviceLastAccessed_serviceNamespace :: Lens' ServiceLastAccessed Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed.ServiceLastAccessed
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed.ServiceLastAccessed
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed.ServiceLastAccessed
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed.ServiceLastAccessed
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed.ServiceLastAccessed
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed.ServiceLastAccessed
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.ServiceLastAccessed.ServiceLastAccessed


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User

-- | Contains information about an IAM user entity.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateUser</li>
--   <li>GetUser</li>
--   <li>ListUsers</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUser</a> smart constructor.
data User
User' :: Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> User

-- | For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundary:User'] :: User -> Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   user's password was last used to sign in to an Amazon Web Services
--   website. For a list of Amazon Web Services websites that capture a
--   user's last sign-in time, see the <a>Credential reports</a> topic in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>. If a password is used more than once in a
--   five-minute span, only the first use is returned in this field. If the
--   field is null (no value), then it indicates that they never signed in
--   with a password. This can be because:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user never had a password.</li>
--   <li>A password exists but has not been used since IAM started tracking
--   this information on October 20, 2014.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A null value does not mean that the user <i>never</i> had a password.
--   Also, if the user does not currently have a password but had one in
--   the past, then this field contains the date and time the most recent
--   password was used.
--   
--   This value is returned only in the GetUser and ListUsers operations.
[$sel:passwordLastUsed:User'] :: User -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A list of tags that are associated with the user. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:User'] :: User -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The path to the user. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   user.
[$sel:path:User'] :: User -> Maybe Text

-- | The friendly name identifying the user.
[$sel:userName:User'] :: User -> Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the user. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:userId:User'] :: User -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the user. For more
--   information about ARNs and how to use ARNs in policies, see <a>IAM
--   Identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:arn:User'] :: User -> Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the user
--   was created.
[$sel:createDate:User'] :: User -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>User</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundary:User'</a>, <a>user_permissionsBoundary</a>
--   - For more information about permissions boundaries, see
--   <a>Permissions boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordLastUsed:User'</a>, <a>user_passwordLastUsed</a> - The
--   date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the user's
--   password was last used to sign in to an Amazon Web Services website.
--   For a list of Amazon Web Services websites that capture a user's last
--   sign-in time, see the <a>Credential reports</a> topic in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>. If a password is used more than once in a five-minute
--   span, only the first use is returned in this field. If the field is
--   null (no value), then it indicates that they never signed in with a
--   password. This can be because:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user never had a password.</li>
--   <li>A password exists but has not been used since IAM started tracking
--   this information on October 20, 2014.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A null value does not mean that the user <i>never</i> had a password.
--   Also, if the user does not currently have a password but had one in
--   the past, then this field contains the date and time the most recent
--   password was used.
--   
--   This value is returned only in the GetUser and ListUsers operations.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:User'</a>, <a>user_tags</a> - A list of tags that are
--   associated with the user. For more information about tagging, see
--   <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:User'</a>, <a>user_path</a> - The path to the user. For
--   more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:User'</a>, <a>user_userName</a> - The friendly name
--   identifying the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:User'</a>, <a>user_userId</a> - The stable and unique
--   string identifying the user. For more information about IDs, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:User'</a>, <a>user_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) that identifies the user. For more information about ARNs and
--   how to use ARNs in policies, see <a>IAM Identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:User'</a>, <a>user_createDate</a> - The date and
--   time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the user was created.
newUser :: Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> User

-- | For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
user_permissionsBoundary :: Lens' User (Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary)

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   user's password was last used to sign in to an Amazon Web Services
--   website. For a list of Amazon Web Services websites that capture a
--   user's last sign-in time, see the <a>Credential reports</a> topic in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>. If a password is used more than once in a
--   five-minute span, only the first use is returned in this field. If the
--   field is null (no value), then it indicates that they never signed in
--   with a password. This can be because:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user never had a password.</li>
--   <li>A password exists but has not been used since IAM started tracking
--   this information on October 20, 2014.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   A null value does not mean that the user <i>never</i> had a password.
--   Also, if the user does not currently have a password but had one in
--   the past, then this field contains the date and time the most recent
--   password was used.
--   
--   This value is returned only in the GetUser and ListUsers operations.
user_passwordLastUsed :: Lens' User (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A list of tags that are associated with the user. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
user_tags :: Lens' User (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The path to the user. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   user.
user_path :: Lens' User (Maybe Text)

-- | The friendly name identifying the user.
user_userName :: Lens' User Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the user. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
user_userId :: Lens' User Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that identifies the user. For more
--   information about ARNs and how to use ARNs in policies, see <a>IAM
--   Identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
user_arn :: Lens' User Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the user
--   was created.
user_createDate :: Lens' User UTCTime
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User.User
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User.User
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User.User
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User.User
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User.User
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User.User
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.User.User


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.UserDetail

-- | Contains information about an IAM user, including all the user's
--   policies and all the IAM groups the user is in.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetAccountAuthorizationDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newUserDetail</a> smart constructor.
data UserDetail
UserDetail' :: Maybe [AttachedPolicy] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicyDetail] -> Maybe Text -> UserDetail

-- | A list of the managed policies attached to the user.
[$sel:attachedManagedPolicies:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe [AttachedPolicy]

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the user
--   was created.
[$sel:createDate:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   user.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundary:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary
[$sel:arn:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of IAM groups that the user is in.
[$sel:groupList:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the user. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:userId:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags that are associated with the user. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The friendly name identifying the user.
[$sel:userName:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the inline policies embedded in the user.
[$sel:userPolicyList:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe [PolicyDetail]

-- | The path to the user. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:UserDetail'] :: UserDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UserDetail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachedManagedPolicies:UserDetail'</a>,
--   <a>userDetail_attachedManagedPolicies</a> - A list of the managed
--   policies attached to the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:UserDetail'</a>, <a>userDetail_createDate</a> - The
--   date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the user was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundary:UserDetail'</a>,
--   <a>userDetail_permissionsBoundary</a> - The ARN of the policy used to
--   set the permissions boundary for the user.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:UserDetail'</a>, <a>userDetail_arn</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupList:UserDetail'</a>, <a>userDetail_groupList</a> - A
--   list of IAM groups that the user is in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userId:UserDetail'</a>, <a>userDetail_userId</a> - The stable
--   and unique string identifying the user. For more information about
--   IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:UserDetail'</a>, <a>userDetail_tags</a> - A list of tags
--   that are associated with the user. For more information about tagging,
--   see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:UserDetail'</a>, <a>userDetail_userName</a> - The
--   friendly name identifying the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userPolicyList:UserDetail'</a>,
--   <a>userDetail_userPolicyList</a> - A list of the inline policies
--   embedded in the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:UserDetail'</a>, <a>userDetail_path</a> - The path to the
--   user. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
newUserDetail :: UserDetail

-- | A list of the managed policies attached to the user.
userDetail_attachedManagedPolicies :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe [AttachedPolicy])

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the user
--   was created.
userDetail_createDate :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   user.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
userDetail_permissionsBoundary :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe AttachedPermissionsBoundary)

-- | Undocumented member.
userDetail_arn :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of IAM groups that the user is in.
userDetail_groupList :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe [Text])

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the user. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
userDetail_userId :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of tags that are associated with the user. For more information
--   about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
userDetail_tags :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The friendly name identifying the user.
userDetail_userName :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the inline policies embedded in the user.
userDetail_userPolicyList :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe [PolicyDetail])

-- | The path to the user. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
userDetail_path :: Lens' UserDetail (Maybe Text)
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.UserDetail.UserDetail
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.UserDetail.UserDetail
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.Types.UserDetail.UserDetail
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.UserDetail.UserDetail
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.UserDetail.UserDetail

instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.UserDetail.UserDetail


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types.VirtualMFADevice

-- | Contains information about a virtual MFA device.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newVirtualMFADevice</a> smart constructor.
data VirtualMFADevice
VirtualMFADevice' :: Maybe User -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe (Sensitive Base64) -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe (Sensitive Base64) -> Text -> VirtualMFADevice

-- | The IAM user associated with this virtual MFA device.
[$sel:user:VirtualMFADevice'] :: VirtualMFADevice -> Maybe User

-- | The date and time on which the virtual MFA device was enabled.
[$sel:enableDate:VirtualMFADevice'] :: VirtualMFADevice -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | A QR code PNG image that encodes
--   <tt>otpauth://totp/$virtualMFADeviceName@$AccountName?secret=$Base32String</tt>
--   where <tt>$virtualMFADeviceName</tt> is one of the create call
--   arguments. <tt>AccountName</tt> is the user name if set (otherwise,
--   the account ID otherwise), and <tt>Base32String</tt> is the seed in
--   base32 format. The <tt>Base32String</tt> value is base64-encoded.
[$sel:qRCodePNG:VirtualMFADevice'] :: VirtualMFADevice -> Maybe (Sensitive Base64)

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the virtual MFA device. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:VirtualMFADevice'] :: VirtualMFADevice -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | The base32 seed defined as specified in <a>RFC3548</a>. The
--   <tt>Base32StringSeed</tt> is base64-encoded.
[$sel:base32StringSeed:VirtualMFADevice'] :: VirtualMFADevice -> Maybe (Sensitive Base64)

-- | The serial number associated with <tt>VirtualMFADevice</tt>.
[$sel:serialNumber:VirtualMFADevice'] :: VirtualMFADevice -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>VirtualMFADevice</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:user:VirtualMFADevice'</a>, <a>virtualMFADevice_user</a> - The
--   IAM user associated with this virtual MFA device.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableDate:VirtualMFADevice'</a>,
--   <a>virtualMFADevice_enableDate</a> - The date and time on which the
--   virtual MFA device was enabled.
--   
--   <a>$sel:qRCodePNG:VirtualMFADevice'</a>,
--   <a>virtualMFADevice_qRCodePNG</a> - A QR code PNG image that encodes
--   <tt>otpauth://totp/$virtualMFADeviceName@$AccountName?secret=$Base32String</tt>
--   where <tt>$virtualMFADeviceName</tt> is one of the create call
--   arguments. <tt>AccountName</tt> is the user name if set (otherwise,
--   the account ID otherwise), and <tt>Base32String</tt> is the seed in
--   base32 format. The <tt>Base32String</tt> value is base64-encoded.-- --
--   <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:tags:VirtualMFADevice'</a>, <a>virtualMFADevice_tags</a> - A
--   list of tags that are attached to the virtual MFA device. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:base32StringSeed:VirtualMFADevice'</a>,
--   <a>virtualMFADevice_base32StringSeed</a> - The base32 seed defined as
--   specified in <a>RFC3548</a>. The <tt>Base32StringSeed</tt> is
--   base64-encoded.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically
--   encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will
--   encode to Base64 representation during -- serialisation, and decode
--   from Base64 representation during deserialisation. -- This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw unencoded data.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serialNumber:VirtualMFADevice'</a>,
--   <a>virtualMFADevice_serialNumber</a> - The serial number associated
--   with <tt>VirtualMFADevice</tt>.
newVirtualMFADevice :: Text -> VirtualMFADevice

-- | The IAM user associated with this virtual MFA device.
virtualMFADevice_user :: Lens' VirtualMFADevice (Maybe User)

-- | The date and time on which the virtual MFA device was enabled.
virtualMFADevice_enableDate :: Lens' VirtualMFADevice (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | A QR code PNG image that encodes
--   <tt>otpauth://totp/$virtualMFADeviceName@$AccountName?secret=$Base32String</tt>
--   where <tt>$virtualMFADeviceName</tt> is one of the create call
--   arguments. <tt>AccountName</tt> is the user name if set (otherwise,
--   the account ID otherwise), and <tt>Base32String</tt> is the seed in
--   base32 format. The <tt>Base32String</tt> value is base64-encoded.-- --
--   <i>Note:</i> This <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes
--   Base64 data. -- The underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64
--   representation during -- serialisation, and decode from Base64
--   representation during deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts
--   and returns only raw unencoded data.
virtualMFADevice_qRCodePNG :: Lens' VirtualMFADevice (Maybe ByteString)

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the virtual MFA device. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
virtualMFADevice_tags :: Lens' VirtualMFADevice (Maybe [Tag])

-- | The base32 seed defined as specified in <a>RFC3548</a>. The
--   <tt>Base32StringSeed</tt> is base64-encoded.-- -- <i>Note:</i> This
--   <tt>Lens</tt> automatically encodes and decodes Base64 data. -- The
--   underlying isomorphism will encode to Base64 representation during --
--   serialisation, and decode from Base64 representation during
--   deserialisation. -- This <tt>Lens</tt> accepts and returns only raw
--   unencoded data.
virtualMFADevice_base32StringSeed :: Lens' VirtualMFADevice (Maybe ByteString)

-- | The serial number associated with <tt>VirtualMFADevice</tt>.
virtualMFADevice_serialNumber :: Lens' VirtualMFADevice Text
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.Types.VirtualMFADevice.VirtualMFADevice
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.Types.VirtualMFADevice.VirtualMFADevice
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.Types.VirtualMFADevice.VirtualMFADevice
instance Network.AWS.Data.XML.FromXML Network.AWS.IAM.Types.VirtualMFADevice.VirtualMFADevice
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.Types.VirtualMFADevice.VirtualMFADevice
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.Types.VirtualMFADevice.VirtualMFADevice


module Network.AWS.IAM.Types

-- | API version <tt>2010-05-08</tt> of the Amazon Identity and Access
--   Management SDK configuration.
defaultService :: Service

-- | The request was rejected because the policy document was malformed.
--   The error message describes the specific error.
_MalformedPolicyDocumentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request failed because a provided policy could not be successfully
--   evaluated. An additional detailed message indicates the source of the
--   failure.
_PolicyEvaluationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The specified service does not support service-specific credentials.
_ServiceNotSupportedException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request failed because the maximum number of concurrent requests
--   for this account are already running.
_ReportGenerationLimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the public key encoding format is
--   unsupported or unrecognized.
_UnrecognizedPublicKeyEncodingException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the public key certificate and the
--   private key do not match.
_KeyPairMismatchException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the SSH public key is already
--   associated with the specified IAM user.
_DuplicateSSHPublicKeyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request failed because Amazon Web Services service role policies
--   can only be attached to the service-linked role for that service.
_PolicyNotAttachableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because an invalid or out-of-range value was
--   supplied for an input parameter.
_InvalidInputException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the public key is malformed or
--   otherwise invalid.
_InvalidPublicKeyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because only the service that depends on the
--   service-linked role can modify or delete the role on your behalf. The
--   error message includes the name of the service that depends on this
--   service-linked role. You must request the change through that service.
_UnmodifiableEntityException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the same certificate is associated
--   with an IAM user in the account.
_DuplicateCertificateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the certificate was malformed or
--   expired. The error message describes the specific error.
_MalformedCertificateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request processing has failed because of an unknown error,
--   exception or failure.
_ServiceFailureException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because multiple requests to change this
--   object were submitted simultaneously. Wait a few minutes and submit
--   your request again.
_ConcurrentModificationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it attempted to create a resource
--   that already exists.
_EntityAlreadyExistsException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the type of user for the transaction
--   was incorrect.
_InvalidUserTypeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the credential report does not exist.
--   To generate a credential report, use GenerateCredentialReport.
_CredentialReportNotPresentException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the credential report is still being
--   generated.
_CredentialReportNotReadyException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the provided password did not meet
--   the requirements imposed by the account password policy.
_PasswordPolicyViolationException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it attempted to create resources
--   beyond the current Amazon Web Services account limits. The error
--   message describes the limit exceeded.
_LimitExceededException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it referenced an entity that is
--   temporarily unmodifiable, such as a user name that was deleted and
--   then recreated. The error indicates that the request is likely to
--   succeed if you try again after waiting several minutes. The error
--   message describes the entity.
_EntityTemporarilyUnmodifiableException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the certificate is invalid.
_InvalidCertificateException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the authentication code was not
--   recognized. The error message describes the specific error.
_InvalidAuthenticationCodeException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it referenced a resource entity that
--   does not exist. The error message describes the resource.
_NoSuchEntityException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because it attempted to delete a resource
--   that has attached subordinate entities. The error message describes
--   these entities.
_DeleteConflictException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError

-- | The request was rejected because the most recent credential report has
--   expired. To generate a new credential report, use
--   GenerateCredentialReport. For more information about credential report
--   expiration, see <a>Getting credential reports</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
_CredentialReportExpiredException :: AsError a => Getting (First ServiceError) a ServiceError
