-- | An object that contains details about when a principal in the reported
--   Organizations entity last attempted to access an Amazon Web Services
--   service. A principal can be an IAM user, an IAM role, or the Amazon
--   Web Services account root user within the reported Organizations
--   entity.
--   
--   This data type is a response element in the
--   GetOrganizationsAccessReport operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessDetail</a> smart constructor.
data AccessDetail
AccessDetail' :: Maybe Int -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> AccessDetail

-- | The number of accounts with authenticated principals (root users, IAM
--   users, and IAM roles) that attempted to access the service in the
--   reporting period.
[$sel:totalAuthenticatedEntities:AccessDetail'] :: AccessDetail -> Maybe Int

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an
--   authenticated principal most recently attempted to access the service.
--   Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals in the reported Organizations
--   entity attempted to access the service within the <a>reporting
--   period</a>.
[$sel:lastAuthenticatedTime:AccessDetail'] :: AccessDetail -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The path of the Organizations entity (root, organizational unit, or
--   account) from which an authenticated principal last attempted to
--   access the service. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals (IAM users, IAM roles, or root
--   users) in the reported Organizations entity attempted to access the
--   service within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:entityPath:AccessDetail'] :: AccessDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The Region where the last service access attempt occurred.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals in the reported Organizations
--   entity attempted to access the service within the <a>reporting
--   period</a>.
[$sel:region:AccessDetail'] :: AccessDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the service in which access was attempted.
[$sel:serviceName:AccessDetail'] :: AccessDetail -> Text

-- | The namespace of the service in which access was attempted.
--   
--   To learn the service namespace of a service, see <a>Actions,
--   resources, and condition keys for Amazon Web Services services</a> in
--   the <i>Service Authorization Reference</i>. Choose the name of the
--   service to view details for that service. In the first paragraph, find
--   the service prefix. For example, <tt>(service prefix: a4b)</tt>. For
--   more information about service namespaces, see <a>Amazon Web Services
--   service namespaces</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
[$sel:serviceNamespace:AccessDetail'] :: AccessDetail -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:totalAuthenticatedEntities:AccessDetail'</a>,
--   <a>accessDetail_totalAuthenticatedEntities</a> - The number of
--   accounts with authenticated principals (root users, IAM users, and IAM
--   roles) that attempted to access the service in the reporting period.
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAuthenticatedTime:AccessDetail'</a>,
--   <a>accessDetail_lastAuthenticatedTime</a> - The date and time, in
--   <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an authenticated principal most
--   recently attempted to access the service. Amazon Web Services does not
--   report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals in the reported Organizations
--   entity attempted to access the service within the <a>reporting
--   period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityPath:AccessDetail'</a>, <a>accessDetail_entityPath</a> -
--   The path of the Organizations entity (root, organizational unit, or
--   account) from which an authenticated principal last attempted to
--   access the service. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals (IAM users, IAM roles, or root
--   users) in the reported Organizations entity attempted to access the
--   service within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:AccessDetail'</a>, <a>accessDetail_region</a> - The
--   Region where the last service access attempt occurred.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals in the reported Organizations
--   entity attempted to access the service within the <a>reporting
--   period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:AccessDetail'</a>, <a>accessDetail_serviceName</a>
--   - The name of the service in which access was attempted.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceNamespace:AccessDetail'</a>,
--   <a>accessDetail_serviceNamespace</a> - The namespace of the service in
--   which access was attempted.
--   
--   To learn the service namespace of a service, see <a>Actions,
--   resources, and condition keys for Amazon Web Services services</a> in
--   the <i>Service Authorization Reference</i>. Choose the name of the
--   service to view details for that service. In the first paragraph, find
--   the service prefix. For example, <tt>(service prefix: a4b)</tt>. For
--   more information about service namespaces, see <a>Amazon Web Services
--   service namespaces</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
newAccessDetail :: Text -> Text -> AccessDetail

-- | The number of accounts with authenticated principals (root users, IAM
--   users, and IAM roles) that attempted to access the service in the
--   reporting period.
accessDetail_totalAuthenticatedEntities :: Lens' AccessDetail (Maybe Int)

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when an
--   authenticated principal most recently attempted to access the service.
--   Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals in the reported Organizations
--   entity attempted to access the service within the <a>reporting
--   period</a>.
accessDetail_lastAuthenticatedTime :: Lens' AccessDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The path of the Organizations entity (root, organizational unit, or
--   account) from which an authenticated principal last attempted to
--   access the service. Amazon Web Services does not report
--   unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals (IAM users, IAM roles, or root
--   users) in the reported Organizations entity attempted to access the
--   service within the <a>reporting period</a>.
accessDetail_entityPath :: Lens' AccessDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The Region where the last service access attempt occurred.
--   
--   This field is null if no principals in the reported Organizations
--   entity attempted to access the service within the <a>reporting
--   period</a>.
accessDetail_region :: Lens' AccessDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the service in which access was attempted.
accessDetail_serviceName :: Lens' AccessDetail Text

-- | The namespace of the service in which access was attempted.
--   
--   To learn the service namespace of a service, see <a>Actions,
--   resources, and condition keys for Amazon Web Services services</a> in
--   the <i>Service Authorization Reference</i>. Choose the name of the
--   service to view details for that service. In the first paragraph, find
--   the service prefix. For example, <tt>(service prefix: a4b)</tt>. For
--   more information about service namespaces, see <a>Amazon Web Services
--   service namespaces</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General
--   Reference</i>.
accessDetail_serviceNamespace :: Lens' AccessDetail Text

-- | Contains information about an Amazon Web Services access key.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the CreateAccessKey
--   and ListAccessKeys operations.
--   
--   The <tt>SecretAccessKey</tt> value is returned only in response to
--   CreateAccessKey. You can get a secret access key only when you first
--   create an access key; you cannot recover the secret access key later.
--   If you lose a secret access key, you must create a new access key.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKeyInfo</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKeyInfo
AccessKeyInfo' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> Text -> AccessKey -> StatusType -> Sensitive Text -> AccessKeyInfo

-- | The date when the access key was created.
[$sel:createDate:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the IAM user that the access key is associated with.
[$sel:userName:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> Text

-- | The ID for this access key.
[$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
[$sel:status:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> StatusType

-- | The secret key used to sign requests.
[$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKeyInfo'] :: AccessKeyInfo -> Sensitive Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKeyInfo</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:AccessKeyInfo'</a>, <a>accessKeyInfo_createDate</a>
--   - The date when the access key was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:AccessKeyInfo'</a>, <a>accessKeyInfo_userName</a> -
--   The name of the IAM user that the access key is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyInfo_accessKeyId</a> - The ID for this access key.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccessKeyInfo'</a>, <a>accessKeyInfo_status</a> - The
--   status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is valid
--   for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:secretAccessKey:AccessKeyInfo'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyInfo_secretAccessKey</a> - The secret key used to sign
--   requests.
newAccessKeyInfo :: Text -> AccessKey -> StatusType -> Text -> AccessKeyInfo

-- | The date when the access key was created.
accessKeyInfo_createDate :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM user that the access key is associated with.
accessKeyInfo_userName :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo Text

-- | The ID for this access key.
accessKeyInfo_accessKeyId :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo AccessKey

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
accessKeyInfo_status :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo StatusType

-- | The secret key used to sign requests.
accessKeyInfo_secretAccessKey :: Lens' AccessKeyInfo Text

-- | Contains information about the last time an Amazon Web Services access
--   key was used since IAM began tracking this information on April 22,
--   2015.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetAccessKeyLastUsed operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKeyLastUsed</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKeyLastUsed
AccessKeyLastUsed' :: ISO8601 -> Text -> Text -> AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   access key was most recently used. This field is null in the following
--   situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM began
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:lastUsedDate:AccessKeyLastUsed'] :: AccessKeyLastUsed -> ISO8601

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services service with which this access key
--   was most recently used. The value of this field is "N/A" in the
--   following situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM started
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
[$sel:serviceName:AccessKeyLastUsed'] :: AccessKeyLastUsed -> Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region where this access key was most recently
--   used. The value for this field is "N/A" in the following situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM began
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon Web Services Regions, see <a>Regions
--   and endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
[$sel:region:AccessKeyLastUsed'] :: AccessKeyLastUsed -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKeyLastUsed</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastUsedDate:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyLastUsed_lastUsedDate</a> - The date and time, in <a>ISO
--   8601 date-time format</a>, when the access key was most recently used.
--   This field is null in the following situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM began
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceName:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyLastUsed_serviceName</a> - The name of the Amazon Web
--   Services service with which this access key was most recently used.
--   The value of this field is "N/A" in the following situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM started
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <a>$sel:region:AccessKeyLastUsed'</a>, <a>accessKeyLastUsed_region</a>
--   - The Amazon Web Services Region where this access key was most
--   recently used. The value for this field is "N/A" in the following
--   situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM began
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon Web Services Regions, see <a>Regions
--   and endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
newAccessKeyLastUsed :: UTCTime -> Text -> Text -> AccessKeyLastUsed

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   access key was most recently used. This field is null in the following
--   situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM began
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
accessKeyLastUsed_lastUsedDate :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed UTCTime

-- | The name of the Amazon Web Services service with which this access key
--   was most recently used. The value of this field is "N/A" in the
--   following situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM started
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
accessKeyLastUsed_serviceName :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed Text

-- | The Amazon Web Services Region where this access key was most recently
--   used. The value for this field is "N/A" in the following situations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>The user does not have an access key.</li>
--   <li>An access key exists but has not been used since IAM began
--   tracking this information.</li>
--   <li>There is no sign-in data associated with the user.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about Amazon Web Services Regions, see <a>Regions
--   and endpoints</a> in the Amazon Web Services General Reference.
accessKeyLastUsed_region :: Lens' AccessKeyLastUsed Text

-- | Contains information about an Amazon Web Services access key, without
--   its secret key.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the ListAccessKeys
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAccessKeyMetadata</a> smart constructor.
data AccessKeyMetadata
AccessKeyMetadata' :: Maybe StatusType -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe AccessKey -> AccessKeyMetadata

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls; <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
[$sel:status:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe StatusType

-- | The date when the access key was created.
[$sel:createDate:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The name of the IAM user that the key is associated with.
[$sel:userName:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID for this access key.
[$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyMetadata'] :: AccessKeyMetadata -> Maybe AccessKey

-- | Create a value of <a>AccessKeyMetadata</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>, <a>accessKeyMetadata_status</a>
--   - The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls; <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyMetadata_createDate</a> - The date when the access key was
--   created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyMetadata_userName</a> - The name of the IAM user that the
--   key is associated with.
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:AccessKeyMetadata'</a>,
--   <a>accessKeyMetadata_accessKeyId</a> - The ID for this access key.
newAccessKeyMetadata :: AccessKeyMetadata

-- | The status of the access key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key is
--   valid for API calls; <tt>Inactive</tt> means it is not.
accessKeyMetadata_status :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe StatusType)

-- | The date when the access key was created.
accessKeyMetadata_createDate :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The name of the IAM user that the key is associated with.
accessKeyMetadata_userName :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID for this access key.
accessKeyMetadata_accessKeyId :: Lens' AccessKeyMetadata (Maybe AccessKey)

-- | Contains information about an attached permissions boundary.
--   
--   An attached permissions boundary is a managed policy that has been
--   attached to a user or role to set the permissions boundary.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachedPermissionsBoundary</a> smart constructor.
data AttachedPermissionsBoundary
AttachedPermissionsBoundary' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryAttachmentType -> AttachedPermissionsBoundary

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   user or role.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryArn:AttachedPermissionsBoundary'] :: AttachedPermissionsBoundary -> Maybe Text

-- | The permissions boundary usage type that indicates what type of IAM
--   resource is used as the permissions boundary for an entity. This data
--   type can only have a value of <tt>Policy</tt>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryType:AttachedPermissionsBoundary'] :: AttachedPermissionsBoundary -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryAttachmentType

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachedPermissionsBoundary</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   <a>attachedPermissionsBoundary_permissionsBoundaryArn</a> - The ARN of
--   the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the user or role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundaryType:AttachedPermissionsBoundary'</a>,
--   <a>attachedPermissionsBoundary_permissionsBoundaryType</a> - The
--   permissions boundary usage type that indicates what type of IAM
--   resource is used as the permissions boundary for an entity. This data
--   type can only have a value of <tt>Policy</tt>.
newAttachedPermissionsBoundary :: AttachedPermissionsBoundary

-- | The ARN of the policy used to set the permissions boundary for the
--   user or role.
attachedPermissionsBoundary_permissionsBoundaryArn :: Lens' AttachedPermissionsBoundary (Maybe Text)

-- | The permissions boundary usage type that indicates what type of IAM
--   resource is used as the permissions boundary for an entity. This data
--   type can only have a value of <tt>Policy</tt>.
attachedPermissionsBoundary_permissionsBoundaryType :: Lens' AttachedPermissionsBoundary (Maybe PermissionsBoundaryAttachmentType)

-- | Contains information about an attached policy.
--   
--   An attached policy is a managed policy that has been attached to a
--   user, group, or role. This data type is used as a response element in
--   the ListAttachedGroupPolicies, ListAttachedRolePolicies,
--   ListAttachedUserPolicies, and GetAccountAuthorizationDetails
--   operations.
--   
--   For more information about managed policies, refer to <a>Managed
--   policies and inline policies</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newAttachedPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data AttachedPolicy
AttachedPolicy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> AttachedPolicy

-- | The friendly name of the attached policy.
[$sel:policyName:AttachedPolicy'] :: AttachedPolicy -> Maybe Text
[$sel:policyArn:AttachedPolicy'] :: AttachedPolicy -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AttachedPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   policy.
--

--   - Undocumented member.
newAttachedPolicy :: AttachedPolicy

-- | The friendly name of the attached policy.
attachedPolicy_policyName :: Lens' AttachedPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
attachedPolicy_policyArn :: Lens' AttachedPolicy (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains information about a condition context key. It includes the
--   name of the key and specifies the value (or values, if the context key
--   supports multiple values) to use in the simulation. This information
--   is used when evaluating the <tt>Condition</tt> elements of the input
--   policies.
--   
--   This data type is used as an input parameter to SimulateCustomPolicy
--   and SimulatePrincipalPolicy.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newContextEntry</a> smart constructor.
data ContextEntry
ContextEntry' :: Maybe [Text] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ContextKeyTypeEnum -> ContextEntry

-- | The value (or values, if the condition context key supports multiple
--   values) to provide to the simulation when the key is referenced by a
--   <tt>Condition</tt> element in an input policy.
[$sel:contextKeyValues:ContextEntry'] :: ContextEntry -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The full name of a condition context key, including the service
--   prefix. For example, <tt>aws:SourceIp</tt> or <tt>s3:VersionId</tt>.
[$sel:contextKeyName:ContextEntry'] :: ContextEntry -> Maybe Text

-- | The data type of the value (or values) specified in the
--   <tt>ContextKeyValues</tt> parameter.
[$sel:contextKeyType:ContextEntry'] :: ContextEntry -> Maybe ContextKeyTypeEnum

-- | Create a value of <a>ContextEntry</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contextKeyValues:ContextEntry'</a>,
--   <a>contextEntry_contextKeyValues</a> - The value (or values, if the
--   condition context key supports multiple values) to provide to the
--   simulation when the key is referenced by a <tt>Condition</tt> element
--   in an input policy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contextKeyName:ContextEntry'</a>,
--   <a>contextEntry_contextKeyName</a> - The full name of a condition
--   context key, including the service prefix. For example,
--   <tt>aws:SourceIp</tt> or <tt>s3:VersionId</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:contextKeyType:ContextEntry'</a>,
--   <a>contextEntry_contextKeyType</a> - The data type of the value (or
--   values) specified in the <tt>ContextKeyValues</tt> parameter.
newContextEntry :: ContextEntry

-- | The value (or values, if the condition context key supports multiple
--   values) to provide to the simulation when the key is referenced by a
--   <tt>Condition</tt> element in an input policy.
contextEntry_contextKeyValues :: Lens' ContextEntry (Maybe [Text])

-- | The full name of a condition context key, including the service
--   prefix. For example, <tt>aws:SourceIp</tt> or <tt>s3:VersionId</tt>.
contextEntry_contextKeyName :: Lens' ContextEntry (Maybe Text)

-- | The data type of the value (or values) specified in the
--   <tt>ContextKeyValues</tt> parameter.
contextEntry_contextKeyType :: Lens' ContextEntry (Maybe ContextKeyTypeEnum)

-- | The reason that the service-linked role deletion failed.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetServiceLinkedRoleDeletionStatus operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newDeletionTaskFailureReasonType</a> smart constructor.
data DeletionTaskFailureReasonType
DeletionTaskFailureReasonType' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe [RoleUsageType] -> DeletionTaskFailureReasonType

-- | A short description of the reason that the service-linked role
--   deletion failed.
[$sel:reason:DeletionTaskFailureReasonType'] :: DeletionTaskFailureReasonType -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of objects that contains details about the service-linked role
--   deletion failure, if that information is returned by the service. If
--   the service-linked role has active sessions or if any resources that
--   were used by the role have not been deleted from the linked service,
--   the role can't be deleted. This parameter includes a list of the
--   resources that are associated with the role and the Region in which
--   the resources are being used.
[$sel:roleUsageList:DeletionTaskFailureReasonType'] :: DeletionTaskFailureReasonType -> Maybe [RoleUsageType]

-- | Create a value of <a>DeletionTaskFailureReasonType</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:reason:DeletionTaskFailureReasonType'</a>,
--   <a>deletionTaskFailureReasonType_reason</a> - A short description of
--   the reason that the service-linked role deletion failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleUsageList:DeletionTaskFailureReasonType'</a>,
--   <a>deletionTaskFailureReasonType_roleUsageList</a> - A list of objects
--   that contains details about the service-linked role deletion failure,
--   if that information is returned by the service. If the service-linked
--   role has active sessions or if any resources that were used by the
--   role have not been deleted from the linked service, the role can't be
--   deleted. This parameter includes a list of the resources that are
--   associated with the role and the Region in which the resources are
--   being used.
newDeletionTaskFailureReasonType :: DeletionTaskFailureReasonType

-- | A short description of the reason that the service-linked role
--   deletion failed.
deletionTaskFailureReasonType_reason :: Lens' DeletionTaskFailureReasonType (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of objects that contains details about the service-linked role
--   deletion failure, if that information is returned by the service. If
--   the service-linked role has active sessions or if any resources that
--   were used by the role have not been deleted from the linked service,
--   the role can't be deleted. This parameter includes a list of the
--   resources that are associated with the role and the Region in which
--   the resources are being used.
deletionTaskFailureReasonType_roleUsageList :: Lens' DeletionTaskFailureReasonType (Maybe [RoleUsageType])

-- | An object that contains details about when the IAM entities (users or
--   roles) were last used in an attempt to access the specified Amazon Web
--   Services service.
--   
--   This data type is a response element in the
--   GetServiceLastAccessedDetailsWithEntities operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityDetails</a> smart constructor.
data EntityDetails
EntityDetails' :: Maybe ISO8601 -> EntityInfo -> EntityDetails

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   authenticated entity last attempted to access Amazon Web Services.
--   Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
[$sel:lastAuthenticated:EntityDetails'] :: EntityDetails -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The <tt>EntityInfo</tt> object that contains details about the entity
--   (user or role).
[$sel:entityInfo:EntityDetails'] :: EntityDetails -> EntityInfo

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:lastAuthenticated:EntityDetails'</a>,
--   <a>entityDetails_lastAuthenticated</a> - The date and time, in <a>ISO
--   8601 date-time format</a>, when the authenticated entity last
--   attempted to access Amazon Web Services. Amazon Web Services does not
--   report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:entityInfo:EntityDetails'</a>, <a>entityDetails_entityInfo</a>
--   - The <tt>EntityInfo</tt> object that contains details about the
--   entity (user or role).
newEntityDetails :: EntityInfo -> EntityDetails

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   authenticated entity last attempted to access Amazon Web Services.
--   Amazon Web Services does not report unauthenticated requests.
--   
--   This field is null if no IAM entities attempted to access the service
--   within the <a>reporting period</a>.
entityDetails_lastAuthenticated :: Lens' EntityDetails (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The <tt>EntityInfo</tt> object that contains details about the entity
--   (user or role).
entityDetails_entityInfo :: Lens' EntityDetails EntityInfo

-- | Contains details about the specified entity (user or role).
--   
--   This data type is an element of the EntityDetails object.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEntityInfo</a> smart constructor.
data EntityInfo
EntityInfo' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> Text -> PolicyOwnerEntityType -> Text -> EntityInfo

-- | The path to the entity (user or role). For more information about
--   paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:EntityInfo'] :: EntityInfo -> Maybe Text
[$sel:arn:EntityInfo'] :: EntityInfo -> Text

-- | The name of the entity (user or role).
[$sel:name:EntityInfo'] :: EntityInfo -> Text

-- | The type of entity (user or role).
[$sel:type':EntityInfo'] :: EntityInfo -> PolicyOwnerEntityType

-- | The identifier of the entity (user or role).
[$sel:id:EntityInfo'] :: EntityInfo -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>EntityInfo</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:EntityInfo'</a>, <a>entityInfo_path</a> - The path to the
--   entity (user or role). For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:EntityInfo'</a>, <a>entityInfo_arn</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:name:EntityInfo'</a>, <a>entityInfo_name</a> - The name of the
--   entity (user or role).
--   
--   <a>$sel:type':EntityInfo'</a>, <a>entityInfo_type</a> - The type of
--   entity (user or role).
--   
--   <a>$sel:id:EntityInfo'</a>, <a>entityInfo_id</a> - The identifier of
--   the entity (user or role).
newEntityInfo :: Text -> Text -> PolicyOwnerEntityType -> Text -> EntityInfo

-- | The path to the entity (user or role). For more information about
--   paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
entityInfo_path :: Lens' EntityInfo (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
entityInfo_arn :: Lens' EntityInfo Text

-- | The name of the entity (user or role).
entityInfo_name :: Lens' EntityInfo Text

-- | The type of entity (user or role).
entityInfo_type :: Lens' EntityInfo PolicyOwnerEntityType

-- | The identifier of the entity (user or role).
entityInfo_id :: Lens' EntityInfo Text

-- | Contains information about the reason that the operation failed.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetOrganizationsAccessReport, GetServiceLastAccessedDetails, and
--   GetServiceLastAccessedDetailsWithEntities operations.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newErrorDetails</a> smart constructor.
data ErrorDetails
ErrorDetails' :: Text -> Text -> ErrorDetails

-- | Detailed information about the reason that the operation failed.
[$sel:message:ErrorDetails'] :: ErrorDetails -> Text

-- | The error code associated with the operation failure.
[$sel:code:ErrorDetails'] :: ErrorDetails -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>ErrorDetails</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:message:ErrorDetails'</a>, <a>errorDetails_message</a> -
--   Detailed information about the reason that the operation failed.
--   
--   <a>$sel:code:ErrorDetails'</a>, <a>errorDetails_code</a> - The error
--   code associated with the operation failure.
newErrorDetails :: Text -> Text -> ErrorDetails

-- | Detailed information about the reason that the operation failed.
errorDetails_message :: Lens' ErrorDetails Text

-- | The error code associated with the operation failure.
errorDetails_code :: Lens' ErrorDetails Text

-- | Contains the results of a simulation.
--   
--   This data type is used by the return parameter of <tt>
--   SimulateCustomPolicy </tt> and <tt> SimulatePrincipalPolicy </tt>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newEvaluationResult</a> smart constructor.
data EvaluationResult
EvaluationResult' :: Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType) -> Maybe OrganizationsDecisionDetail -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail -> Maybe [ResourceSpecificResult] -> Maybe [Statement] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Text] -> Text -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType -> EvaluationResult

-- | Additional details about the results of the cross-account evaluation
--   decision. This parameter is populated for only cross-account
--   simulations. It contains a brief summary of how each policy type
--   contributes to the final evaluation decision.
--   
--   If the simulation evaluates policies within the same account and
--   includes a resource ARN, then the parameter is present but the
--   response is empty. If the simulation evaluates policies within the
--   same account and specifies all resources (<tt>*</tt>), then the
--   parameter is not returned.
--   
--   When you make a cross-account request, Amazon Web Services evaluates
--   the request in the trusting account and the trusted account. The
--   request is allowed only if both evaluations return <tt>true</tt>. For
--   more information about how policies are evaluated, see <a>Evaluating
--   policies within a single account</a>.
--   
--   If an Organizations SCP included in the evaluation denies access, the
--   simulation ends. In this case, policy evaluation does not proceed any
--   further and this parameter is not returned.
[$sel:evalDecisionDetails:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType)

-- | A structure that details how Organizations and its service control
--   policies affect the results of the simulation. Only applies if the
--   simulated user's account is part of an organization.
[$sel:organizationsDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe OrganizationsDecisionDetail

-- | Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when the boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail

-- | The individual results of the simulation of the API operation
--   specified in EvalActionName on each resource.
[$sel:resourceSpecificResults:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe [ResourceSpecificResult]

-- | A list of the statements in the input policies that determine the
--   result for this scenario. Remember that even if multiple statements
--   allow the operation on the resource, if only one statement denies that
--   operation, then the explicit deny overrides any allow. In addition,
--   the deny statement is the only entry included in the result.
[$sel:matchedStatements:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe [Statement]

-- | The ARN of the resource that the indicated API operation was tested
--   on.
[$sel:evalResourceName:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of context keys that are required by the included input
--   policies but that were not provided by one of the input parameters.
--   This list is used when the resource in a simulation is "*", either
--   explicitly, or when the <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter blank. If you
--   include a list of resources, then any missing context values are
--   instead included under the <tt>ResourceSpecificResults</tt> section.
--   To discover the context keys used by a set of policies, you can call
--   GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
[$sel:missingContextValues:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Maybe [Text]

-- | The name of the API operation tested on the indicated resource.
[$sel:evalActionName:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> Text

-- | The result of the simulation.
[$sel:evalDecision:EvaluationResult'] :: EvaluationResult -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType

-- | Create a value of <a>EvaluationResult</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalDecisionDetails:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalDecisionDetails</a> - Additional details about
--   the results of the cross-account evaluation decision. This parameter
--   is populated for only cross-account simulations. It contains a brief
--   summary of how each policy type contributes to the final evaluation
--   decision.
--   
--   If the simulation evaluates policies within the same account and
--   includes a resource ARN, then the parameter is present but the
--   response is empty. If the simulation evaluates policies within the
--   same account and specifies all resources (<tt>*</tt>), then the
--   parameter is not returned.
--   
--   When you make a cross-account request, Amazon Web Services evaluates
--   the request in the trusting account and the trusted account. The
--   request is allowed only if both evaluations return <tt>true</tt>. For
--   more information about how policies are evaluated, see <a>Evaluating
--   policies within a single account</a>.
--   
--   If an Organizations SCP included in the evaluation denies access, the
--   simulation ends. In this case, policy evaluation does not proceed any
--   further and this parameter is not returned.
--   
--   <a>$sel:organizationsDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_organizationsDecisionDetail</a> - A structure that
--   details how Organizations and its service control policies affect the
--   results of the simulation. Only applies if the simulated user's
--   account is part of an organization.
--   
--   <a>$sel:permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail</a> - Contains
--   information about the effect that a permissions boundary has on a
--   policy simulation when the boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
--   
--   <a>$sel:resourceSpecificResults:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_resourceSpecificResults</a> - The individual
--   results of the simulation of the API operation specified in
--   EvalActionName on each resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:matchedStatements:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_matchedStatements</a> - A list of the statements
--   in the input policies that determine the result for this scenario.
--   Remember that even if multiple statements allow the operation on the
--   resource, if only one statement denies that operation, then the
--   explicit deny overrides any allow. In addition, the deny statement is
--   the only entry included in the result.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalResourceName:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalResourceName</a> - The ARN of the resource
--   that the indicated API operation was tested on.
--   
--   <a>$sel:missingContextValues:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_missingContextValues</a> - A list of context keys
--   that are required by the included input policies but that were not
--   provided by one of the input parameters. This list is used when the
--   resource in a simulation is "*", either explicitly, or when the
--   <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter blank. If you include a list of
--   resources, then any missing context values are instead included under
--   the <tt>ResourceSpecificResults</tt> section. To discover the context
--   keys used by a set of policies, you can call
--   GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalActionName:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalActionName</a> - The name of the API operation
--   tested on the indicated resource.
--   
--   <a>$sel:evalDecision:EvaluationResult'</a>,
--   <a>evaluationResult_evalDecision</a> - The result of the simulation.
newEvaluationResult :: Text -> PolicyEvaluationDecisionType -> EvaluationResult

-- | Additional details about the results of the cross-account evaluation
--   decision. This parameter is populated for only cross-account
--   simulations. It contains a brief summary of how each policy type
--   contributes to the final evaluation decision.
--   
--   If the simulation evaluates policies within the same account and
--   includes a resource ARN, then the parameter is present but the
--   response is empty. If the simulation evaluates policies within the
--   same account and specifies all resources (<tt>*</tt>), then the
--   parameter is not returned.
--   
--   When you make a cross-account request, Amazon Web Services evaluates
--   the request in the trusting account and the trusted account. The
--   request is allowed only if both evaluations return <tt>true</tt>. For
--   more information about how policies are evaluated, see <a>Evaluating
--   policies within a single account</a>.
--   
--   If an Organizations SCP included in the evaluation denies access, the
--   simulation ends. In this case, policy evaluation does not proceed any
--   further and this parameter is not returned.
evaluationResult_evalDecisionDetails :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe (HashMap Text PolicyEvaluationDecisionType))

-- | A structure that details how Organizations and its service control
--   policies affect the results of the simulation. Only applies if the
--   simulated user's account is part of an organization.
evaluationResult_organizationsDecisionDetail :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe OrganizationsDecisionDetail)

-- | Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when the boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
evaluationResult_permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail)

-- | The individual results of the simulation of the API operation
--   specified in EvalActionName on each resource.
evaluationResult_resourceSpecificResults :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe [ResourceSpecificResult])

-- | A list of the statements in the input policies that determine the
--   result for this scenario. Remember that even if multiple statements
--   allow the operation on the resource, if only one statement denies that
--   operation, then the explicit deny overrides any allow. In addition,
--   the deny statement is the only entry included in the result.
evaluationResult_matchedStatements :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe [Statement])

-- | The ARN of the resource that the indicated API operation was tested
--   on.
evaluationResult_evalResourceName :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of context keys that are required by the included input
--   policies but that were not provided by one of the input parameters.
--   This list is used when the resource in a simulation is "*", either
--   explicitly, or when the <tt>ResourceArns</tt> parameter blank. If you
--   include a list of resources, then any missing context values are
--   instead included under the <tt>ResourceSpecificResults</tt> section.
--   To discover the context keys used by a set of policies, you can call
--   GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy or GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy.
evaluationResult_missingContextValues :: Lens' EvaluationResult (Maybe [Text])

-- | The name of the API operation tested on the indicated resource.
evaluationResult_evalActionName :: Lens' EvaluationResult Text

-- | The result of the simulation.
evaluationResult_evalDecision :: Lens' EvaluationResult PolicyEvaluationDecisionType

-- | Contains the response to a successful GetContextKeysForPrincipalPolicy
--   or GetContextKeysForCustomPolicy request.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGetContextKeysForPolicyResponse</a> smart
--   constructor.
data GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse
GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse' :: Maybe [Text] -> GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse

-- | The list of context keys that are referenced in the input policies.
[$sel:contextKeyNames:GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse'] :: GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse -> Maybe [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:contextKeyNames:GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse'</a>,
--   <a>getContextKeysForPolicyResponse_contextKeyNames</a> - The list of
--   context keys that are referenced in the input policies.
newGetContextKeysForPolicyResponse :: GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse

-- | The list of context keys that are referenced in the input policies.
getContextKeysForPolicyResponse_contextKeyNames :: Lens' GetContextKeysForPolicyResponse (Maybe [Text])

-- | Contains information about an IAM group entity.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the following
--   operations:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>CreateGroup</li>
--   <li>GetGroup</li>
--   <li>ListGroups</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGroup</a> smart constructor.
data Group
Group' :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> Group

-- | The path to the group. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:Group'] :: Group -> Text

-- | The friendly name that identifies the group.
[$sel:groupName:Group'] :: Group -> Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the group. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:groupId:Group'] :: Group -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the group. For more
--   information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:arn:Group'] :: Group -> Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the group
--   was created.
[$sel:createDate:Group'] :: Group -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>Group</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:Group'</a>, <a>group_path</a> - The path to the group.
--   For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupName:Group'</a>, <a>group_groupName</a> - The friendly
--   name that identifies the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:Group'</a>, <a>group_groupId</a> - The stable and
--   unique string identifying the group. For more information about IDs,
--   see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:Group'</a>, <a>group_arn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) specifying the group. For more information about ARNs and how to
--   use them in policies, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:Group'</a>, <a>group_createDate</a> - The date and
--   time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the group was created.
newGroup :: Text -> Text -> Text -> Text -> UTCTime -> Group

-- | The path to the group. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
group_path :: Lens' Group Text

-- | The friendly name that identifies the group.
group_groupName :: Lens' Group Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the group. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
group_groupId :: Lens' Group Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the group. For more
--   information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
group_arn :: Lens' Group Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the group
--   was created.
group_createDate :: Lens' Group UTCTime

-- | Contains information about an IAM group, including all of the group's
--   policies.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetAccountAuthorizationDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newGroupDetail</a> smart constructor.
data GroupDetail
GroupDetail' :: Maybe [AttachedPolicy] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicyDetail] -> GroupDetail

-- | A list of the managed policies attached to the group.
[$sel:attachedManagedPolicies:GroupDetail'] :: GroupDetail -> Maybe [AttachedPolicy]

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the group
--   was created.
[$sel:createDate:GroupDetail'] :: GroupDetail -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The friendly name that identifies the group.
[$sel:groupName:GroupDetail'] :: GroupDetail -> Maybe Text
[$sel:arn:GroupDetail'] :: GroupDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the group. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
[$sel:groupId:GroupDetail'] :: GroupDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The path to the group. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:GroupDetail'] :: GroupDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of the inline policies embedded in the group.
[$sel:groupPolicyList:GroupDetail'] :: GroupDetail -> Maybe [PolicyDetail]

-- | Create a value of <a>GroupDetail</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:attachedManagedPolicies:GroupDetail'</a>,
--   <a>groupDetail_attachedManagedPolicies</a> - A list of the managed
--   policies attached to the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:GroupDetail'</a>, <a>groupDetail_createDate</a> -
--   The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the group
--   was created.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupName:GroupDetail'</a>, <a>groupDetail_groupName</a> - The
--   friendly name that identifies the group.
--   
--   <a>$sel:arn:GroupDetail'</a>, <a>groupDetail_arn</a> - Undocumented
--   member.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupId:GroupDetail'</a>, <a>groupDetail_groupId</a> - The
--   stable and unique string identifying the group. For more information
--   about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:GroupDetail'</a>, <a>groupDetail_path</a> - The path to
--   the group. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupPolicyList:GroupDetail'</a>,
--   <a>groupDetail_groupPolicyList</a> - A list of the inline policies
--   embedded in the group.
newGroupDetail :: GroupDetail

-- | A list of the managed policies attached to the group.
groupDetail_attachedManagedPolicies :: Lens' GroupDetail (Maybe [AttachedPolicy])

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the group
--   was created.
groupDetail_createDate :: Lens' GroupDetail (Maybe UTCTime)

-- | The friendly name that identifies the group.
groupDetail_groupName :: Lens' GroupDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Undocumented member.
groupDetail_arn :: Lens' GroupDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the group. For more
--   information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
groupDetail_groupId :: Lens' GroupDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The path to the group. For more information about paths, see <a>IAM
--   identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
groupDetail_path :: Lens' GroupDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | A list of the inline policies embedded in the group.
groupDetail_groupPolicyList :: Lens' GroupDetail (Maybe [PolicyDetail])

-- | Contains information about an instance profile.

--   more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM
--   User Guide</i>.
[$sel:instanceProfileId:InstanceProfile'] :: InstanceProfile -> Text

--   more information about ARNs and how to use them in policies, see

--   list of tags that are attached to the instance profile. For more

--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:path:InstanceProfile'</a>, <a>instanceProfile_path</a> - The
--   path to the instance profile. For more information about paths, see
--   <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.

--   instance profile.

--   string identifying the instance profile. For more information about
--   IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.

--   Amazon Resource Name (ARN) specifying the instance profile. For more

--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newLoginProfile</a> smart constructor.
data LoginProfile

-- | Specifies whether the user is required to set a new password on next
--   sign-in.
[$sel:passwordResetRequired:LoginProfile'] :: LoginProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The name of the user, which can be used for signing in to the Amazon
--   Web Services Management Console.
[$sel:userName:LoginProfile'] :: LoginProfile -> Text

-- | The date when the password for the user was created.

--   omitted.

--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:LoginProfile'</a>, <a>loginProfile_userName</a> - The
--   name of the user, which can be used for signing in to the Amazon Web
--   Services Management Console.
--   
--   <a>$sel:createDate:LoginProfile'</a>, <a>loginProfile_createDate</a> -
--   The date when the password for the user was created.
newLoginProfile :: Text -> UTCTime -> LoginProfile

--   sign-in.

--   Web Services Management Console.

loginProfile_createDate :: Lens' LoginProfile UTCTime

-- | Contains information about an MFA device.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the ListMFADevices
--   operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newMFADevice</a> smart constructor.
data MFADevice
MFADevice' :: Text -> Text -> ISO8601 -> MFADevice

-- | The user with whom the MFA device is associated.
[$sel:userName:MFADevice'] :: MFADevice -> Text

-- | The serial number that uniquely identifies the MFA device. For virtual
--   MFA devices, the serial number is the device ARN.
[$sel:serialNumber:MFADevice'] :: MFADevice -> Text

-- | The date when the MFA device was enabled for the user.
[$sel:enableDate:MFADevice'] :: MFADevice -> ISO8601

-- | Create a value of <a>MFADevice</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   with whom the MFA device is associated.
--   
--   <a>$sel:serialNumber:MFADevice'</a>, <a>mfaDevice_serialNumber</a> -
--   The serial number that uniquely identifies the MFA device. For virtual
--   MFA devices, the serial number is the device ARN.
--   
--   <a>$sel:enableDate:MFADevice'</a>, <a>mfaDevice_enableDate</a> - The
--   date when the MFA device was enabled for the user.

-- | The user with whom the MFA device is associated.

--   MFA devices, the serial number is the device ARN.
mfaDevice_serialNumber :: Lens' MFADevice Text

-- | The date when the MFA device was enabled for the user.
mfaDevice_enableDate :: Lens' MFADevice UTCTime

-- | Contains information about a managed policy, including the policy's
--   ARN, versions, and the number of principal entities (users, groups,
--   and roles) that the policy is attached to.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetAccountAuthorizationDetails operation.
--   
--   For more information about managed policies, see <a>Managed policies
--   and inline policies</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newManagedPolicyDetail</a> smart constructor.
data ManagedPolicyDetail
ManagedPolicyDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [PolicyVersion] -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> ManagedPolicyDetail

-- | The friendly name (not ARN) identifying the policy.
[$sel:policyName:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of entities (users and roles) for which the policy is used
--   as the permissions boundary.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryUsageCount:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether the policy can be attached to an IAM user, group, or
--   role.
[$sel:isAttachable:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was created.
[$sel:createDate:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe ISO8601
[$sel:arn:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of principal entities (users, groups, and roles) that the
--   policy is attached to.
[$sel:attachmentCount:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Int

-- | The identifier for the version of the policy that is set as the
--   default (operative) version.
--   
--   For more information about policy versions, see <a>Versioning for
--   managed policies</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:defaultVersionId:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A friendly description of the policy.
[$sel:description:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | A list containing information about the versions of the policy.
[$sel:policyVersionList:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe [PolicyVersion]

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was last updated.
--   
--   When a policy has only one version, this field contains the date and
--   time when the policy was created. When a policy has more than one
--   version, this field contains the date and time when the most recent
--   policy version was created.
[$sel:updateDate:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The path to the policy.
--   
--   For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:ManagedPolicyDetail'] :: ManagedPolicyDetail -> Maybe Text

--   
--   For more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.

-- | Contains information about the effect that Organizations has on a

-- | Contains information about the account password policy.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetAccountPasswordPolicy operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPasswordPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data PasswordPolicy
PasswordPolicy' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> PasswordPolicy

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   lowercase character (a to z).
[$sel:requireLowercaseCharacters:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of days that an IAM user password is valid.
[$sel:maxPasswordAge:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the number of previous passwords that IAM users are
--   prevented from reusing.
[$sel:passwordReusePrevention:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Natural

-- | Minimum length to require for IAM user passwords.
[$sel:minimumPasswordLength:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Natural

-- | Indicates whether passwords in the account expire. Returns true if
--   <tt>MaxPasswordAge</tt> contains a value greater than 0. Returns false
--   if MaxPasswordAge is 0 or not present.
[$sel:expirePasswords:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   uppercase character (A to Z).
[$sel:requireUppercaseCharacters:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether IAM users are allowed to change their own password.
[$sel:allowUsersToChangePassword:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether IAM users are prevented from setting a new password
--   after their password has expired.
[$sel:hardExpiry:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one of the
--   following symbols:
--   
--   ! @ # $ % ^ &amp; * ( ) _ + - = [ ] { } | '
[$sel:requireSymbols:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one numeric
--   character (0 to 9).
[$sel:requireNumbers:PasswordPolicy'] :: PasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PasswordPolicy</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireLowercaseCharacters:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_requireLowercaseCharacters</a> - Specifies whether
--   IAM user passwords must contain at least one lowercase character (a to
--   z).
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxPasswordAge:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_maxPasswordAge</a> - The number of days that an IAM
--   user password is valid.
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordReusePrevention:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_passwordReusePrevention</a> - Specifies the number
--   of previous passwords that IAM users are prevented from reusing.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumPasswordLength:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_minimumPasswordLength</a> - Minimum length to
--   require for IAM user passwords.
--   
--   <a>$sel:expirePasswords:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_expirePasswords</a> - Indicates whether passwords in
--   the account expire. Returns true if <tt>MaxPasswordAge</tt> contains a
--   value greater than 0. Returns false if MaxPasswordAge is 0 or not
--   present.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireUppercaseCharacters:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_requireUppercaseCharacters</a> - Specifies whether
--   IAM user passwords must contain at least one uppercase character (A to
--   Z).
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowUsersToChangePassword:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_allowUsersToChangePassword</a> - Specifies whether
--   IAM users are allowed to change their own password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hardExpiry:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_hardExpiry</a> - Specifies whether IAM users are
--   prevented from setting a new password after their password has
--   expired.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireSymbols:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_requireSymbols</a> - Specifies whether IAM user
--   passwords must contain at least one of the following symbols:
--   
--   ! @ # $ % ^ &amp; * ( ) _ + - = [ ] { } | '
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireNumbers:PasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>passwordPolicy_requireNumbers</a> - Specifies whether IAM user
--   passwords must contain at least one numeric character (0 to 9).
newPasswordPolicy :: PasswordPolicy

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   lowercase character (a to z).
passwordPolicy_requireLowercaseCharacters :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of days that an IAM user password is valid.
passwordPolicy_maxPasswordAge :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the number of previous passwords that IAM users are
--   prevented from reusing.
passwordPolicy_passwordReusePrevention :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | Minimum length to require for IAM user passwords.
passwordPolicy_minimumPasswordLength :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | Indicates whether passwords in the account expire. Returns true if
--   <tt>MaxPasswordAge</tt> contains a value greater than 0. Returns false
--   if MaxPasswordAge is 0 or not present.
passwordPolicy_expirePasswords :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   uppercase character (A to Z).
passwordPolicy_requireUppercaseCharacters :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether IAM users are allowed to change their own password.
passwordPolicy_allowUsersToChangePassword :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether IAM users are prevented from setting a new password
--   after their password has expired.
passwordPolicy_hardExpiry :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one of the
--   following symbols:
--   
--   ! @ # $ % ^ &amp; * ( ) _ + - = [ ] { } | '
passwordPolicy_requireSymbols :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one numeric
--   character (0 to 9).
passwordPolicy_requireNumbers :: Lens' PasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Contains information about the effect that a permissions boundary has
--   on a policy simulation when the boundary is applied to an IAM entity.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail</a> smart
--   constructor.
data PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail
PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail' :: Maybe Bool -> PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail

-- | Specifies whether an action is allowed by a permissions boundary that
--   is applied to an IAM entity (user or role). A value of <tt>true</tt>
--   means that the permissions boundary does not deny the action. This
--   means that the policy includes an <tt>Allow</tt> statement that
--   matches the request. In this case, if an identity-based policy also
--   allows the action, the request is allowed. A value of <tt>false</tt>
--   means that either the requested action is not allowed (implicitly
--   denied) or that the action is explicitly denied by the permissions
--   boundary. In both of these cases, the action is not allowed,
--   regardless of the identity-based policy.
[$sel:allowedByPermissionsBoundary:PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail'] :: PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowedByPermissionsBoundary:PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail'</a>,
--   <a>permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail_allowedByPermissionsBoundary</a>
--   - Specifies whether an action is allowed by a permissions boundary
--   that is applied to an IAM entity (user or role). A value of
--   <tt>true</tt> means that the permissions boundary does not deny the
--   action. This means that the policy includes an <tt>Allow</tt>
--   statement that matches the request. In this case, if an identity-based
--   policy also allows the action, the request is allowed. A value of
--   <tt>false</tt> means that either the requested action is not allowed
--   (implicitly denied) or that the action is explicitly denied by the
--   permissions boundary. In both of these cases, the action is not
--   allowed, regardless of the identity-based policy.
newPermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail :: PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail

-- | Specifies whether an action is allowed by a permissions boundary that
--   is applied to an IAM entity (user or role). A value of <tt>true</tt>
--   means that the permissions boundary does not deny the action. This
--   means that the policy includes an <tt>Allow</tt> statement that
--   matches the request. In this case, if an identity-based policy also
--   allows the action, the request is allowed. A value of <tt>false</tt>
--   means that either the requested action is not allowed (implicitly
--   denied) or that the action is explicitly denied by the permissions
--   boundary. In both of these cases, the action is not allowed,
--   regardless of the identity-based policy.
permissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail_allowedByPermissionsBoundary :: Lens' PermissionsBoundaryDecisionDetail (Maybe Bool)

-- | Contains information about a managed policy.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the CreatePolicy,
--   GetPolicy, and ListPolicies operations.
--   
--   For more information about managed policies, refer to <a>Managed
--   policies and inline policies</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data Policy
Policy' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Int -> Maybe Text -> Maybe [Tag] -> Maybe Text -> Maybe ISO8601 -> Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Policy

-- | The friendly name (not ARN) identifying the policy.
[$sel:policyName:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of entities (users and roles) for which the policy is used
--   to set the permissions boundary.
--   
--   For more information about permissions boundaries, see <a>Permissions
--   boundaries for IAM identities</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:permissionsBoundaryUsageCount:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Int

-- | Specifies whether the policy can be attached to an IAM user, group, or
--   role.
[$sel:isAttachable:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Bool

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was created.
[$sel:createDate:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe ISO8601
[$sel:arn:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The number of entities (users, groups, and roles) that the policy is
--   attached to.
[$sel:attachmentCount:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Int

-- | The identifier for the version of the policy that is set as the
--   default version.
[$sel:defaultVersionId:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | A list of tags that are attached to the instance profile. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:tags:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe [Tag]

-- | A friendly description of the policy.
--   
--   This element is included in the response to the GetPolicy operation.
--   It is not included in the response to the ListPolicies operation.
[$sel:description:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The date and time, in <a>ISO 8601 date-time format</a>, when the
--   policy was last updated.
--   
--   When a policy has only one version, this field contains the date and
--   time when the policy was created. When a policy has more than one
--   version, this field contains the date and time when the most recent
--   policy version was created.
[$sel:updateDate:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe ISO8601

-- | The path to the policy.
--   
--   For more information about paths, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:path:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | The stable and unique string identifying the policy.
--   
--   For more information about IDs, see <a>IAM identifiers</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:policyId:Policy'] :: Policy -> Maybe Text

-- | Contains information about an IAM policy, including the policy
--   document.
--   
--   This data type is used as a response element in the
--   GetAccountAuthorizationDetails operation.
--   
--   <i>See:</i> <a>newPolicyDetail</a> smart constructor.
data PolicyDetail
PolicyDetail' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> PolicyDetail

-- | The name of the policy.
[$sel:policyName:PolicyDetail'] :: PolicyDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | The policy document.
[$sel:policyDocument:PolicyDetail'] :: PolicyDetail -> Maybe Text

-- | Create a value of <a>PolicyDetail</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.

--   <a>policyDetail_policyDocument</a> - The policy document.
newPolicyDetail :: PolicyDetail

-- | The name of the policy.
policyDetail_policyName :: Lens' PolicyDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | The policy document.
policyDetail_policyDocument :: Lens' PolicyDetail (Maybe Text)

-- | Contains details about the permissions policies that are attached to
--   the specified identity (user, group, or role).
--   
--   This data type is an element of the
--   ListPoliciesGrantingServiceAccessEntry object.

--   attached.
--

--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
