-- | Adds the specified IAM role to the specified instance profile. An
--   instance profile can contain only one role, and this quota cannot be
--   increased. You can remove the existing role and then add a different
--   role to an instance profile. You must then wait for the change to
--   appear across all of Amazon Web Services because of <a>eventual
--   consistency</a>. To force the change, you must <a>disassociate the
--   instance profile</a> and then <a>associate the instance profile</a>,
--   or you can stop your instance and then restart it.
--   
--   The caller of this operation must be granted the <tt>PassRole</tt>
--   permission on the IAM role by a permissions policy.
--   
--   For more information about roles, see <a>Working with roles</a>. For
--   more information about instance profiles, see <a>About instance
--   profiles</a>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.AddRoleToInstanceProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAddRoleToInstanceProfile</a> smart constructor.
data AddRoleToInstanceProfile
AddRoleToInstanceProfile' :: Text -> Text -> AddRoleToInstanceProfile

-- | The name of the instance profile to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:instanceProfileName:AddRoleToInstanceProfile'] :: AddRoleToInstanceProfile -> Text

-- | The name of the role to add.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:roleName:AddRoleToInstanceProfile'] :: AddRoleToInstanceProfile -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>AddRoleToInstanceProfile</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProfileName:AddRoleToInstanceProfile'</a>,
--   <a>addRoleToInstanceProfile_instanceProfileName</a> - The name of the
--   instance profile to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:AddRoleToInstanceProfile'</a>,
--   <a>addRoleToInstanceProfile_roleName</a> - The name of the role to
--   add.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
newAddRoleToInstanceProfile :: Text -> Text -> AddRoleToInstanceProfile

-- | The name of the instance profile to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-

-- | Adds a new client ID (also known as audience) to the list of client
--   IDs already registered for the specified IAM OpenID Connect (OIDC)
--   provider resource.
--   
--   This operation is idempotent; it does not fail or return an error if
--   you add an existing client ID to the provider.
module Network.AWS.IAM.AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newAddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider</a> smart
--   constructor.
data AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider
AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider' :: Text -> Text -> AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM OpenID Connect (OIDC)
--   provider resource to add the client ID to. You can get a list of OIDC
--   provider ARNs by using the ListOpenIDConnectProviders operation.
[$sel:openIDConnectProviderArn:AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider'] :: AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider -> Text

-- | The client ID (also known as audience) to add to the IAM OpenID
--   Connect provider resource.

-- | Create a value of <a>AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   fields.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--

--   <a>$sel:openIDConnectProviderArn:AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider'</a>,
--   <a>addClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider_openIDConnectProviderArn</a> -
--   The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM OpenID Connect (OIDC)
--   provider resource to add the client ID to. You can get a list of OIDC
--   provider ARNs by using the ListOpenIDConnectProviders operation.
--   
--   <a>$sel:clientID:AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider'</a>,
--   <a>addClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider_clientID</a> - The client ID
--   (also known as audience) to add to the IAM OpenID Connect provider
--   resource.
newAddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider :: Text -> Text -> AddClientIDToOpenIDConnectProvider

--   provider ARNs by using the ListOpenIDConnectProviders operation.

-- | Removes the specified tags from the IAM instance profile. For more
--   information about tagging, see <a>Tagging IAM resources</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UntagInstanceProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUntagInstanceProfile</a> smart constructor.
data UntagInstanceProfile
UntagInstanceProfile' :: Text -> [Text] -> UntagInstanceProfile

-- | The name of the IAM instance profile from which you want to remove
--   tags.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:instanceProfileName:UntagInstanceProfile'] :: UntagInstanceProfile -> Text

-- | A list of key names as a simple array of strings. The tags with
--   matching keys are removed from the specified instance profile.
[$sel:tagKeys:UntagInstanceProfile'] :: UntagInstanceProfile -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UntagInstanceProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:instanceProfileName:UntagInstanceProfile'</a>,
--   <a>untagInstanceProfile_instanceProfileName</a> - The name of the IAM
--   instance profile from which you want to remove tags.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagInstanceProfile'</a>,
--   <a>untagInstanceProfile_tagKeys</a> - A list of key names as a simple
--   array of strings. The tags with matching keys are removed from the
--   specified instance profile.
newUntagInstanceProfile :: Text -> UntagInstanceProfile

-- | The name of the IAM instance profile from which you want to remove
--   tags.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
untagInstanceProfile_instanceProfileName :: Lens' UntagInstanceProfile Text

-- | A list of key names as a simple array of strings. The tags with
--   matching keys are removed from the specified instance profile.
untagInstanceProfile_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagInstanceProfile [Text]

--   same as the ARN.

--   characters that consist of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters

--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:tagKeys:UntagRole'</a>, <a>untagRole_tagKeys</a> - A list of
--   key names as a simple array of strings. The tags with matching keys
--   are removed from the specified role.
newUntagRole :: Text -> UntagRole

-- | The name of the IAM role from which you want to remove tags.
--   
--   This parameter accepts (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that consist of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
untagRole_roleName :: Lens' UntagRole Text

-- | A list of key names as a simple array of strings. The tags with
--   matching keys are removed from the specified role.
untagRole_tagKeys :: Lens' UntagRole [Text]

--   omitted.

--   fields.

--   certificates</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.

-- | Changes the status of the specified access key from Active to
--   Inactive, or vice versa. This operation can be used to disable a
--   user's key as part of a key rotation workflow.
--   
--   If the <tt>UserName</tt> is not specified, the user name is determined
--   implicitly based on the Amazon Web Services access key ID used to sign
--   the request. This operation works for access keys under the Amazon Web
--   Services account. Consequently, you can use this operation to manage
--   Amazon Web Services account root user credentials even if the Amazon
--   Web Services account has no associated users.
--   
--   For information about rotating keys, see <a>Managing keys and
--   certificates</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAccessKey</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAccessKey
UpdateAccessKey' :: Maybe Text -> AccessKey -> StatusType -> UpdateAccessKey

-- | The name of the user whose key you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:userName:UpdateAccessKey'] :: UpdateAccessKey -> Maybe Text

-- | The access key ID of the secret access key you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
[$sel:accessKeyId:UpdateAccessKey'] :: UpdateAccessKey -> AccessKey

-- | The status you want to assign to the secret access key.
--   <tt>Active</tt> means that the key can be used for programmatic calls
--   to Amazon Web Services, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key
--   cannot be used.
[$sel:status:UpdateAccessKey'] :: UpdateAccessKey -> StatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAccessKey</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:UpdateAccessKey'</a>, <a>updateAccessKey_userName</a>
--   - The name of the user whose key you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:accessKeyId:UpdateAccessKey'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccessKey_accessKeyId</a> - The access key ID of the secret
--   access key you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateAccessKey'</a>, <a>updateAccessKey_status</a> -
--   The status you want to assign to the secret access key.
--   <tt>Active</tt> means that the key can be used for programmatic calls
--   to Amazon Web Services, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key
--   cannot be used.
newUpdateAccessKey :: AccessKey -> StatusType -> UpdateAccessKey

-- | The name of the user whose key you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
updateAccessKey_userName :: Lens' UpdateAccessKey (Maybe Text)

-- | The access key ID of the secret access key you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
updateAccessKey_accessKeyId :: Lens' UpdateAccessKey AccessKey

-- | The status you want to assign to the secret access key.
--   <tt>Active</tt> means that the key can be used for programmatic calls
--   to Amazon Web Services, while <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key
--   cannot be used.
updateAccessKey_status :: Lens' UpdateAccessKey StatusType

data UpdateAccessKeyResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAccessKeyResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateAccessKeyResponse :: UpdateAccessKeyResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey.UpdateAccessKey
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey.UpdateAccessKey
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey.UpdateAccessKey
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey.UpdateAccessKey
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey.UpdateAccessKeyResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey.UpdateAccessKeyResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccessKey.UpdateAccessKeyResponse

-- | Updates the password policy settings for the Amazon Web Services
--   account.
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>This operation does not support partial updates. No parameters are
--   required, but if you do not specify a parameter, that parameter's
--   value reverts to its default value. See the <b>Request Parameters</b>
--   section for each parameter's default value. Also note that some
--   parameters do not allow the default parameter to be explicitly set.
--   Instead, to invoke the default value, do not include that parameter
--   when you invoke the operation.</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   For more information about using a password policy, see <a>Managing an
--   IAM password policy</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAccountPasswordPolicy</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy
UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Natural -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> Maybe Bool -> UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   lowercase character from the ISO basic Latin alphabet (a to z).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one lowercase character.
[$sel:requireLowercaseCharacters:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | The number of days that an IAM user password is valid.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>0</tt>. The result is that IAM user
--   passwords never expire.
[$sel:maxPasswordAge:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies the number of previous passwords that IAM users are
--   prevented from reusing.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>0</tt>. The result is that IAM users are
--   not prevented from reusing previous passwords.
[$sel:passwordReusePrevention:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Natural

-- | The minimum number of characters allowed in an IAM user password.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>6</tt>.
[$sel:minimumPasswordLength:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Natural

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   uppercase character from the ISO basic Latin alphabet (A to Z).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one uppercase character.
[$sel:requireUppercaseCharacters:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Allows all IAM users in your account to use the Amazon Web Services
--   Management Console to change their own passwords. For more
--   information, see <a>Letting IAM users change their own passwords</a>
--   in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that IAM users
--   in the account do not automatically have permissions to change their
--   own password.
[$sel:allowUsersToChangePassword:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Prevents IAM users from setting a new password after their password
--   has expired. The IAM user cannot be accessed until an administrator
--   resets the password.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that IAM users
--   can change their passwords after they expire and continue to sign in
--   as the user.
[$sel:hardExpiry:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one of the
--   following non-alphanumeric characters:
--   
--   ! @ # $ % ^ &amp; * ( ) _ + - = [ ] { } | '
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one symbol character.
[$sel:requireSymbols:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one numeric
--   character (0 to 9).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one numeric character.
[$sel:requireNumbers:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'] :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy -> Maybe Bool

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireLowercaseCharacters:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireLowercaseCharacters</a> -
--   Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   lowercase character from the ISO basic Latin alphabet (a to z).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one lowercase character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxPasswordAge:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_maxPasswordAge</a> - The number of days
--   that an IAM user password is valid.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>0</tt>. The result is that IAM user
--   passwords never expire.
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordReusePrevention:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_passwordReusePrevention</a> - Specifies
--   the number of previous passwords that IAM users are prevented from
--   reusing.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>0</tt>. The result is that IAM users are
--   not prevented from reusing previous passwords.
--   
--   <a>$sel:minimumPasswordLength:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_minimumPasswordLength</a> - The minimum
--   number of characters allowed in an IAM user password.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>6</tt>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireUppercaseCharacters:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireUppercaseCharacters</a> -
--   Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   uppercase character from the ISO basic Latin alphabet (A to Z).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one uppercase character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:allowUsersToChangePassword:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_allowUsersToChangePassword</a> - Allows
--   all IAM users in your account to use the Amazon Web Services
--   Management Console to change their own passwords. For more
--   information, see <a>Letting IAM users change their own passwords</a>
--   in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that IAM users
--   in the account do not automatically have permissions to change their
--   own password.
--   
--   <a>$sel:hardExpiry:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_hardExpiry</a> - Prevents IAM users
--   from setting a new password after their password has expired. The IAM
--   user cannot be accessed until an administrator resets the password.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that IAM users
--   can change their passwords after they expire and continue to sign in
--   as the user.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireSymbols:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireSymbols</a> - Specifies whether
--   IAM user passwords must contain at least one of the following
--   non-alphanumeric characters:
--   
--   ! @ # $ % ^ &amp; * ( ) _ + - = [ ] { } | '
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one symbol character.
--   
--   <a>$sel:requireNumbers:UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy'</a>,
--   <a>updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireNumbers</a> - Specifies whether
--   IAM user passwords must contain at least one numeric character (0 to
--   9).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one numeric character.
newUpdateAccountPasswordPolicy :: UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   lowercase character from the ISO basic Latin alphabet (a to z).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one lowercase character.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireLowercaseCharacters :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | The number of days that an IAM user password is valid.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>0</tt>. The result is that IAM user
--   passwords never expire.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_maxPasswordAge :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies the number of previous passwords that IAM users are
--   prevented from reusing.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>0</tt>. The result is that IAM users are
--   not prevented from reusing previous passwords.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_passwordReusePrevention :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | The minimum number of characters allowed in an IAM user password.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>6</tt>.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_minimumPasswordLength :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Natural)

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one
--   uppercase character from the ISO basic Latin alphabet (A to Z).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one uppercase character.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireUppercaseCharacters :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Allows all IAM users in your account to use the Amazon Web Services
--   Management Console to change their own passwords. For more
--   information, see <a>Letting IAM users change their own passwords</a>
--   in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that IAM users
--   in the account do not automatically have permissions to change their
--   own password.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_allowUsersToChangePassword :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Prevents IAM users from setting a new password after their password
--   has expired. The IAM user cannot be accessed until an administrator
--   resets the password.
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that IAM users
--   can change their passwords after they expire and continue to sign in
--   as the user.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_hardExpiry :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one of the
--   following non-alphanumeric characters:
--   
--   ! @ # $ % ^ &amp; * ( ) _ + - = [ ] { } | '
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one symbol character.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireSymbols :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Specifies whether IAM user passwords must contain at least one numeric
--   character (0 to 9).
--   
--   If you do not specify a value for this parameter, then the operation
--   uses the default value of <tt>false</tt>. The result is that passwords
--   do not require at least one numeric character.
updateAccountPasswordPolicy_requireNumbers :: Lens' UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy (Maybe Bool)

-- | Updates the policy that grants an IAM entity permission to assume a
--   role. This is typically referred to as the "role trust policy". For
--   more information about roles, see <a>Using roles to delegate
--   permissions and federate identities</a>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateAssumeRolePolicy

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateAssumeRolePolicy</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateAssumeRolePolicy
UpdateAssumeRolePolicy' :: Text -> Text -> UpdateAssumeRolePolicy

-- | The name of the role to update with the new policy.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:roleName:UpdateAssumeRolePolicy'] :: UpdateAssumeRolePolicy -> Text

-- | The policy that grants an entity permission to assume the role.
--   
--   You must provide policies in JSON format in IAM. However, for
--   CloudFormation templates formatted in YAML, you can provide the policy
--   in JSON or YAML format. CloudFormation always converts a YAML policy
--   to JSON format before submitting it to IAM.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> used to validate this parameter is a string
--   of characters consisting of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any printable ASCII character ranging from the space character
--   (<tt>\u0020</tt>) through the end of the ASCII character range</li>
--   <li>The printable characters in the Basic Latin and Latin-1 Supplement
--   character set (through <tt>\u00FF</tt>)</li>
--   <li>The special characters tab (<tt>\u0009</tt>), line feed
--   (<tt>\u000A</tt>), and carriage return (<tt>\u000D</tt>)</li>
--   </ul>

-- | Updates the name and/or the path of the specified IAM group.
--   
--   You should understand the implications of changing a group's path or
--   name. For more information, see <a>Renaming users and groups</a> in
--   the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The person making the request (the principal), must have permission to
--   change the role group with the old name and the new name. For example,
--   to change the group named <tt>Managers</tt> to <tt>MGRs</tt>, the
--   principal must have a policy that allows them to update both groups.
--   If the principal has permission to update the <tt>Managers</tt> group,
--   but not the <tt>MGRs</tt> group, then the update fails. For more
--   information about permissions, see <a>Access management</a>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateGroup

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateGroup</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateGroup
UpdateGroup' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateGroup

-- | New name for the IAM group. Only include this if changing the group's
--   name.
--   
--   IAM user, group, role, and policy names must be unique within the
--   account. Names are not distinguished by case. For example, you cannot
--   create resources named both "MyResource" and "myresource".
[$sel:newGroupName':UpdateGroup'] :: UpdateGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | New path for the IAM group. Only include this if changing the group's
--   path.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of either a forward slash (/) by itself or a
--   string that must begin and end with forward slashes. In addition, it
--   can contain any ASCII character from the ! (<tt>\u0021</tt>) through
--   the DEL character (<tt>\u007F</tt>), including most punctuation
--   characters, digits, and upper and lowercased letters.
[$sel:newPath':UpdateGroup'] :: UpdateGroup -> Maybe Text

-- | Name of the IAM group to update. If you're changing the name of the
--   group, this is the original name.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:groupName:UpdateGroup'] :: UpdateGroup -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateGroup</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:newGroupName':UpdateGroup'</a>,
--   <a>updateGroup_newGroupName</a> - New name for the IAM group. Only
--   include this if changing the group's name.
--   
--   IAM user, group, role, and policy names must be unique within the
--   account. Names are not distinguished by case. For example, you cannot
--   create resources named both "MyResource" and "myresource".
--   
--   <a>$sel:newPath':UpdateGroup'</a>, <a>updateGroup_newPath</a> - New
--   path for the IAM group. Only include this if changing the group's
--   path.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of either a forward slash (/) by itself or a
--   string that must begin and end with forward slashes. In addition, it
--   can contain any ASCII character from the ! (<tt>\u0021</tt>) through
--   the DEL character (<tt>\u007F</tt>), including most punctuation
--   characters, digits, and upper and lowercased letters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:groupName:UpdateGroup'</a>, <a>updateGroup_groupName</a> -
--   Name of the IAM group to update. If you're changing the name of the
--   group, this is the original name.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
newUpdateGroup :: Text -> UpdateGroup

-- | New name for the IAM group. Only include this if changing the group's
--   name.
--   
--   IAM user, group, role, and policy names must be unique within the
--   account. Names are not distinguished by case. For example, you cannot
--   create resources named both "MyResource" and "myresource".
updateGroup_newGroupName :: Lens' UpdateGroup (Maybe Text)

--   path.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of

updateGroup_newPath :: Lens' UpdateGroup (Maybe Text)

--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of

-- | Changes the password for the specified IAM user. You can use the CLI,
--   the Amazon Web Services API, or the <b>Users</b> page in the IAM
--   console to change the password for any IAM user. Use ChangePassword to
--   change your own password in the <b>My Security Credentials</b> page in
--   the Amazon Web Services Management Console.
--   
--   For more information about modifying passwords, see <a>Managing
--   passwords</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLoginProfile</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLoginProfile
UpdateLoginProfile' :: Maybe Bool -> Maybe (Sensitive Text) -> Text -> UpdateLoginProfile

-- | Allows this new password to be used only once by requiring the
--   specified IAM user to set a new password on next sign-in.
[$sel:passwordResetRequired:UpdateLoginProfile'] :: UpdateLoginProfile -> Maybe Bool

-- | The new password for the specified IAM user.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> used to validate this parameter is a string
--   of characters consisting of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any printable ASCII character ranging from the space character
--   (<tt>\u0020</tt>) through the end of the ASCII character range</li>
--   <li>The printable characters in the Basic Latin and Latin-1 Supplement
--   character set (through <tt>\u00FF</tt>)</li>
--   <li>The special characters tab (<tt>\u0009</tt>), line feed
--   (<tt>\u000A</tt>), and carriage return (<tt>\u000D</tt>)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   However, the format can be further restricted by the account
--   administrator by setting a password policy on the Amazon Web Services
--   account. For more information, see UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy.
[$sel:password:UpdateLoginProfile'] :: UpdateLoginProfile -> Maybe (Sensitive Text)

-- | The name of the user whose password you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:userName:UpdateLoginProfile'] :: UpdateLoginProfile -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLoginProfile</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:passwordResetRequired:UpdateLoginProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateLoginProfile_passwordResetRequired</a> - Allows this new
--   password to be used only once by requiring the specified IAM user to
--   set a new password on next sign-in.
--   
--   <a>$sel:password:UpdateLoginProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateLoginProfile_password</a> - The new password for the
--   specified IAM user.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> used to validate this parameter is a string
--   of characters consisting of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any printable ASCII character ranging from the space character
--   (<tt>\u0020</tt>) through the end of the ASCII character range</li>
--   <li>The printable characters in the Basic Latin and Latin-1 Supplement
--   character set (through <tt>\u00FF</tt>)</li>
--   <li>The special characters tab (<tt>\u0009</tt>), line feed
--   (<tt>\u000A</tt>), and carriage return (<tt>\u000D</tt>)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   However, the format can be further restricted by the account
--   administrator by setting a password policy on the Amazon Web Services
--   account. For more information, see UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy.
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:UpdateLoginProfile'</a>,
--   <a>updateLoginProfile_userName</a> - The name of the user whose
--   password you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
newUpdateLoginProfile :: Text -> UpdateLoginProfile

-- | Allows this new password to be used only once by requiring the
--   specified IAM user to set a new password on next sign-in.
updateLoginProfile_passwordResetRequired :: Lens' UpdateLoginProfile (Maybe Bool)

-- | The new password for the specified IAM user.
--   
--   The <a>regex pattern</a> used to validate this parameter is a string
--   of characters consisting of the following:
--   
--   <ul>
--   <li>Any printable ASCII character ranging from the space character
--   (<tt>\u0020</tt>) through the end of the ASCII character range</li>
--   <li>The printable characters in the Basic Latin and Latin-1 Supplement
--   character set (through <tt>\u00FF</tt>)</li>
--   <li>The special characters tab (<tt>\u0009</tt>), line feed
--   (<tt>\u000A</tt>), and carriage return (<tt>\u000D</tt>)</li>
--   </ul>
--   
--   However, the format can be further restricted by the account
--   administrator by setting a password policy on the Amazon Web Services
--   account. For more information, see UpdateAccountPasswordPolicy.
updateLoginProfile_password :: Lens' UpdateLoginProfile (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the user whose password you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
updateLoginProfile_userName :: Lens' UpdateLoginProfile Text

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateLoginProfileResponse</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateLoginProfileResponse
UpdateLoginProfileResponse' :: UpdateLoginProfileResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateLoginProfileResponse</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateLoginProfileResponse :: UpdateLoginProfileResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfileResponse
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfileResponse
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfileResponse
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfileResponse
instance Network.AWS.Types.AWSRequest Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfileResponse
instance Data.Hashable.Class.Hashable Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance Control.DeepSeq.NFData Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance Network.AWS.Data.Headers.ToHeaders Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance Network.AWS.Data.Path.ToPath Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile
instance Network.AWS.Data.Query.ToQuery Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateLoginProfile.UpdateLoginProfile


-- | Replaces the existing list of server certificate thumbprints
--   associated with an OpenID Connect (OIDC) provider resource object with
--   a new list of thumbprints.
--   
--   The list that you pass with this operation completely replaces the
--   existing list of thumbprints. (The lists are not merged.)
--   
--   Typically, you need to update a thumbprint only when the identity
--   provider certificate changes, which occurs rarely. However, if the
--   provider's certificate <i>does</i> change, any attempt to assume an
--   IAM role that specifies the OIDC provider as a principal fails until
--   the certificate thumbprint is updated.
--   
--   Amazon Web Services secures communication with some OIDC identity
--   providers (IdPs) through our library of trusted certificate
--   authorities (CAs) instead of using a certificate thumbprint to verify
--   your IdP server certificate. These OIDC IdPs include Google, and those
--   that use an Amazon S3 bucket to host a JSON Web Key Set (JWKS)
--   endpoint. In these cases, your legacy thumbprint remains in your
--   configuration, but is no longer used for validation.
--   
--   Trust for the OIDC provider is derived from the provider certificate
--   and is validated by the thumbprint. Therefore, it is best to limit
--   access to the <tt>UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint</tt> operation
--   to highly privileged users.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint
UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint' :: Text -> [Text] -> UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM OIDC provider resource
--   object for which you want to update the thumbprint. You can get a list
--   of OIDC provider ARNs by using the ListOpenIDConnectProviders
--   operation.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs, see <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs)</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
[$sel:openIDConnectProviderArn:UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint'] :: UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint -> Text

-- | A list of certificate thumbprints that are associated with the
--   specified IAM OpenID Connect provider. For more information, see
--   CreateOpenIDConnectProvider.
[$sel:thumbprintList:UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint'] :: UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint -> [Text]

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint</a> with
--   all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:openIDConnectProviderArn:UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint'</a>,
--   <a>updateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint_openIDConnectProviderArn</a>
--   - The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM OIDC provider resource
--   object for which you want to update the thumbprint. You can get a list
--   of OIDC provider ARNs by using the ListOpenIDConnectProviders
--   operation.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs, see <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs)</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:thumbprintList:UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint'</a>,
--   <a>updateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint_thumbprintList</a> - A list
--   of certificate thumbprints that are associated with the specified IAM
--   OpenID Connect provider. For more information, see
--   CreateOpenIDConnectProvider.
newUpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint :: Text -> UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the IAM OIDC provider resource
--   object for which you want to update the thumbprint. You can get a list
--   of OIDC provider ARNs by using the ListOpenIDConnectProviders
--   operation.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs, see <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs)</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
updateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint_openIDConnectProviderArn :: Lens' UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint Text

-- | A list of certificate thumbprints that are associated with the
--   specified IAM OpenID Connect provider. For more information, see
--   CreateOpenIDConnectProvider.
updateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint_thumbprintList :: Lens' UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint [Text]

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse</a>
--   smart constructor.
data UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse
UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse' :: UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse</a>
--   with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
newUpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse :: UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint
instance GHC.Show.Show Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint
instance GHC.Read.Read Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint
instance GHC.Classes.Eq Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint
instance GHC.Generics.Generic Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprint.UpdateOpenIDConnectProviderThumbprintResponse

-- | Updates the description or maximum session duration setting of a role.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateRole

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateRole</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateRole
UpdateRole' :: Maybe Natural -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateRole

-- | The maximum session duration (in seconds) that you want to set for the
--   specified role. If you do not specify a value for this setting, the
--   default maximum of one hour is applied. This setting can have a value
--   from 1 hour to 12 hours.
--   
--   Anyone who assumes the role from the CLI or API can use the
--   <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> API parameter or the
--   <tt>duration-seconds</tt> CLI parameter to request a longer session.
--   The <tt>MaxSessionDuration</tt> setting determines the maximum
--   duration that can be requested using the <tt>DurationSeconds</tt>
--   parameter. If users don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> parameter, their security credentials are
--   valid for one hour by default. This applies when you use the
--   <tt>AssumeRole*</tt> API operations or the <tt>assume-role*</tt> CLI
--   operations but does not apply when you use those operations to create
--   a console URL. For more information, see <a>Using IAM roles</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
[$sel:maxSessionDuration:UpdateRole'] :: UpdateRole -> Maybe Natural

-- | The new description that you want to apply to the specified role.
[$sel:description:UpdateRole'] :: UpdateRole -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the role that you want to modify.
[$sel:roleName:UpdateRole'] :: UpdateRole -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateRole</a> with all optional fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:maxSessionDuration:UpdateRole'</a>,
--   <a>updateRole_maxSessionDuration</a> - The maximum session duration
--   (in seconds) that you want to set for the specified role. If you do
--   not specify a value for this setting, the default maximum of one hour
--   is applied. This setting can have a value from 1 hour to 12 hours.
--   
--   Anyone who assumes the role from the CLI or API can use the
--   <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> API parameter or the
--   <tt>duration-seconds</tt> CLI parameter to request a longer session.
--   The <tt>MaxSessionDuration</tt> setting determines the maximum
--   duration that can be requested using the <tt>DurationSeconds</tt>
--   parameter. If users don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> parameter, their security credentials are
--   valid for one hour by default. This applies when you use the
--   <tt>AssumeRole*</tt> API operations or the <tt>assume-role*</tt> CLI
--   operations but does not apply when you use those operations to create
--   a console URL. For more information, see <a>Using IAM roles</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   <a>$sel:description:UpdateRole'</a>, <a>updateRole_description</a> -
--   The new description that you want to apply to the specified role.
--   
--   <a>$sel:roleName:UpdateRole'</a>, <a>updateRole_roleName</a> - The
--   name of the role that you want to modify.
newUpdateRole :: Text -> UpdateRole

-- | The maximum session duration (in seconds) that you want to set for the
--   specified role. If you do not specify a value for this setting, the
--   default maximum of one hour is applied. This setting can have a value
--   from 1 hour to 12 hours.
--   
--   Anyone who assumes the role from the CLI or API can use the
--   <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> API parameter or the
--   <tt>duration-seconds</tt> CLI parameter to request a longer session.
--   The <tt>MaxSessionDuration</tt> setting determines the maximum
--   duration that can be requested using the <tt>DurationSeconds</tt>
--   parameter. If users don't specify a value for the
--   <tt>DurationSeconds</tt> parameter, their security credentials are
--   valid for one hour by default. This applies when you use the
--   <tt>AssumeRole*</tt> API operations or the <tt>assume-role*</tt> CLI
--   operations but does not apply when you use those operations to create
--   a console URL. For more information, see <a>Using IAM roles</a> in the
--   <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
updateRole_maxSessionDuration :: Lens' UpdateRole (Maybe Natural)

-- | The new description that you want to apply to the specified role.
updateRole_description :: Lens' UpdateRole (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the role that you want to modify.
updateRole_roleName :: Lens' UpdateRole Text

-- | Updates the metadata document for an existing SAML provider resource
--   object.
--   
--   This operation requires <a>Signature Version 4</a>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateSAMLProvider

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSAMLProvider</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSAMLProvider
UpdateSAMLProvider' :: Text -> Text -> UpdateSAMLProvider

-- | An XML document generated by an identity provider (IdP) that supports
--   SAML 2.0. The document includes the issuer's name, expiration
--   information, and keys that can be used to validate the SAML
--   authentication response (assertions) that are received from the IdP.
--   You must generate the metadata document using the identity management
--   software that is used as your organization's IdP.
[$sel:sAMLMetadataDocument:UpdateSAMLProvider'] :: UpdateSAMLProvider -> Text

-- | The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the SAML provider to update.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs, see <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs)</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
[$sel:sAMLProviderArn:UpdateSAMLProvider'] :: UpdateSAMLProvider -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSAMLProvider</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:sAMLMetadataDocument:UpdateSAMLProvider'</a>,
--   <a>updateSAMLProvider_sAMLMetadataDocument</a> - An XML document
--   generated by an identity provider (IdP) that supports SAML 2.0. The
--   document includes the issuer's name, expiration information, and keys
--   that can be used to validate the SAML authentication response
--   (assertions) that are received from the IdP. You must generate the
--   metadata document using the identity management software that is used
--   as your organization's IdP.
--   
--   <a>$sel:sAMLProviderArn:UpdateSAMLProvider'</a>,
--   <a>updateSAMLProvider_sAMLProviderArn</a> - The Amazon Resource Name
--   (ARN) of the SAML provider to update.
--   
--   For more information about ARNs, see <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs)</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
newUpdateSAMLProvider :: Text -> Text -> UpdateSAMLProvider

-- | An XML document generated by an identity provider (IdP) that supports
--   SAML 2.0. The document includes the issuer's name, expiration
--   information, and keys that can be used to validate the SAML
--   authentication response (assertions) that are received from the IdP.
--   You must generate the metadata document using the identity management
--   software that is used as your organization's IdP.
updateSAMLProvider_sAMLMetadataDocument :: Lens' UpdateSAMLProvider Text

--   
--   For more information about ARNs, see <a>Amazon Resource Names
--   (ARNs)</a> in the <i>Amazon Web Services General Reference</i>.
updateSAMLProvider_sAMLProviderArn :: Lens' UpdateSAMLProvider Text

-- | Sets the status of an IAM user's SSH public key to active or inactive.
--   SSH public keys that are inactive cannot be used for authentication.
--   This operation can be used to disable a user's SSH public key as part
--   of a key rotation work flow.
--   
--   The SSH public key affected by this operation is used only for
--   authenticating the associated IAM user to an CodeCommit repository.
--   For more information about using SSH keys to authenticate to an
--   CodeCommit repository, see <a>Set up CodeCommit for SSH
--   connections</a> in the <i>CodeCommit User Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateSSHPublicKey

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSSHPublicKey</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSSHPublicKey
UpdateSSHPublicKey' :: Text -> Text -> StatusType -> UpdateSSHPublicKey

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the SSH public key.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:userName:UpdateSSHPublicKey'] :: UpdateSSHPublicKey -> Text

-- | The unique identifier for the SSH public key.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
[$sel:sSHPublicKeyId:UpdateSSHPublicKey'] :: UpdateSSHPublicKey -> Text

-- | The status to assign to the SSH public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that
--   the key can be used for authentication with an CodeCommit repository.
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot be used.
[$sel:status:UpdateSSHPublicKey'] :: UpdateSSHPublicKey -> StatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSSHPublicKey</a> with all optional fields
--   omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:UpdateSSHPublicKey'</a>,
--   <a>updateSSHPublicKey_userName</a> - The name of the IAM user
--   associated with the SSH public key.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:sSHPublicKeyId:UpdateSSHPublicKey'</a>,
--   <a>updateSSHPublicKey_sSHPublicKeyId</a> - The unique identifier for
--   the SSH public key.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateSSHPublicKey'</a>,
--   <a>updateSSHPublicKey_status</a> - The status to assign to the SSH
--   public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that the key can be used for
--   authentication with an CodeCommit repository. <tt>Inactive</tt> means
--   that the key cannot be used.
newUpdateSSHPublicKey :: Text -> Text -> StatusType -> UpdateSSHPublicKey

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the SSH public key.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
updateSSHPublicKey_userName :: Lens' UpdateSSHPublicKey Text

-- | The unique identifier for the SSH public key.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
updateSSHPublicKey_sSHPublicKeyId :: Lens' UpdateSSHPublicKey Text

-- | The status to assign to the SSH public key. <tt>Active</tt> means that
--   the key can be used for authentication with an CodeCommit repository.
--   <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the key cannot be used.
updateSSHPublicKey_status :: Lens' UpdateSSHPublicKey StatusType

-- | Updates the name and/or the path of the specified server certificate
--   stored in IAM.
--   
--   For more information about working with server certificates, see
--   <a>Working with server certificates</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   This topic also includes a list of Amazon Web Services services that
--   can use the server certificates that you manage with IAM.
--   
--   You should understand the implications of changing a server
--   certificate's path or name. For more information, see <a>Renaming a
--   server certificate</a> in the <i>IAM User Guide</i>.
--   
--   The person making the request (the principal), must have permission to
--   change the server certificate with the old name and the new name. For
--   example, to change the certificate named <tt>ProductionCert</tt> to
--   <tt>ProdCert</tt>, the principal must have a policy that allows them
--   to update both certificates. If the principal has permission to update
--   the <tt>ProductionCert</tt> group, but not the <tt>ProdCert</tt>
--   certificate, then the update fails. For more information about
--   permissions, see <a>Access management</a> in the <i>IAM User
--   Guide</i>.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateServerCertificate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateServerCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateServerCertificate
UpdateServerCertificate' :: Maybe Text -> Maybe Text -> Text -> UpdateServerCertificate

-- | The new path for the server certificate. Include this only if you are
--   updating the server certificate's path.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of either a forward slash (/) by itself or a
--   string that must begin and end with forward slashes. In addition, it
--   can contain any ASCII character from the ! (<tt>\u0021</tt>) through
--   the DEL character (<tt>\u007F</tt>), including most punctuation
--   characters, digits, and upper and lowercased letters.
[$sel:newPath':UpdateServerCertificate'] :: UpdateServerCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The new name for the server certificate. Include this only if you are
--   updating the server certificate's name. The name of the certificate
--   cannot contain any spaces.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:newServerCertificateName':UpdateServerCertificate'] :: UpdateServerCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The name of the server certificate that you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:serverCertificateName:UpdateServerCertificate'] :: UpdateServerCertificate -> Text

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateServerCertificate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:newPath':UpdateServerCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateServerCertificate_newPath</a> - The new path for the server
--   certificate. Include this only if you are updating the server
--   certificate's path.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of either a forward slash (/) by itself or a
--   string that must begin and end with forward slashes. In addition, it
--   can contain any ASCII character from the ! (<tt>\u0021</tt>) through
--   the DEL character (<tt>\u007F</tt>), including most punctuation
--   characters, digits, and upper and lowercased letters.
--   
--   <a>$sel:newServerCertificateName':UpdateServerCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateServerCertificate_newServerCertificateName</a> - The new name
--   for the server certificate. Include this only if you are updating the
--   server certificate's name. The name of the certificate cannot contain
--   any spaces.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:serverCertificateName:UpdateServerCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateServerCertificate_serverCertificateName</a> - The name of the
--   server certificate that you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
newUpdateServerCertificate :: Text -> UpdateServerCertificate

-- | The new path for the server certificate. Include this only if you are
--   updating the server certificate's path.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of either a forward slash (/) by itself or a
--   string that must begin and end with forward slashes. In addition, it
--   can contain any ASCII character from the ! (<tt>\u0021</tt>) through
--   the DEL character (<tt>\u007F</tt>), including most punctuation
--   characters, digits, and upper and lowercased letters.
updateServerCertificate_newPath :: Lens' UpdateServerCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The new name for the server certificate. Include this only if you are
--   updating the server certificate's name. The name of the certificate
--   cannot contain any spaces.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
updateServerCertificate_newServerCertificateName :: Lens' UpdateServerCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The name of the server certificate that you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-

-- | Sets the status of a service-specific credential to <tt>Active</tt> or
--   <tt>Inactive</tt>. Service-specific credentials that are inactive
--   cannot be used for authentication to the service. This operation can
--   be used to disable a user's service-specific credential as part of a
--   credential rotation work flow.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateServiceSpecificCredential

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateServiceSpecificCredential</a> smart
--   constructor.
data UpdateServiceSpecificCredential
UpdateServiceSpecificCredential' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> StatusType -> UpdateServiceSpecificCredential

-- | The name of the IAM user associated with the service-specific
--   credential. If you do not specify this value, then the operation
--   assumes the user whose credentials are used to call the operation.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:userName:UpdateServiceSpecificCredential'] :: UpdateServiceSpecificCredential -> Maybe Text

-- | The unique identifier of the service-specific credential.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
[$sel:serviceSpecificCredentialId:UpdateServiceSpecificCredential'] :: UpdateServiceSpecificCredential -> Text

-- | The status to be assigned to the service-specific credential.
[$sel:status:UpdateServiceSpecificCredential'] :: UpdateServiceSpecificCredential -> StatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateServiceSpecificCredential</a> with all
--   optional fields omitted.

--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:

--   user associated with the service-specific credential. If you do not
--   specify this value, then the operation assumes the user whose
--   credentials are used to call the operation.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   
--   <a>$sel:serviceSpecificCredentialId:UpdateServiceSpecificCredential'</a>,
--   <a>updateServiceSpecificCredential_serviceSpecificCredentialId</a> -
--   The unique identifier of the service-specific credential.

-- | Changes the status of the specified user signing certificate from
--   active to disabled, or vice versa. This operation can be used to
--   disable an IAM user's signing certificate as part of a certificate
--   rotation work flow.
--   
--   If the <tt>UserName</tt> field is not specified, the user name is
--   determined implicitly based on the Amazon Web Services access key ID
--   used to sign the request. This operation works for access keys under
--   the Amazon Web Services account. Consequently, you can use this
--   operation to manage Amazon Web Services account root user credentials
--   even if the Amazon Web Services account has no associated users.
module Network.AWS.IAM.UpdateSigningCertificate

-- | <i>See:</i> <a>newUpdateSigningCertificate</a> smart constructor.
data UpdateSigningCertificate
UpdateSigningCertificate' :: Maybe Text -> Text -> StatusType -> UpdateSigningCertificate

-- | The name of the IAM user the signing certificate belongs to.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
[$sel:userName:UpdateSigningCertificate'] :: UpdateSigningCertificate -> Maybe Text

-- | The ID of the signing certificate you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
[$sel:certificateId:UpdateSigningCertificate'] :: UpdateSigningCertificate -> Text

-- | The status you want to assign to the certificate. <tt>Active</tt>
--   means that the certificate can be used for programmatic calls to
--   Amazon Web Services <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the certificate
--   cannot be used.
[$sel:status:UpdateSigningCertificate'] :: UpdateSigningCertificate -> StatusType

-- | Create a value of <a>UpdateSigningCertificate</a> with all optional
--   fields omitted.
--   
--   Use <a>generic-lens</a> or <a>optics</a> to modify other optional
--   fields.
--   
--   The following record fields are available, with the corresponding
--   lenses provided for backwards compatibility:
--   
--   <a>$sel:userName:UpdateSigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateSigningCertificate_userName</a> - The name of the IAM user
--   the signing certificate belongs to.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
--   
--   <a>$sel:certificateId:UpdateSigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateSigningCertificate_certificateId</a> - The ID of the signing
--   certificate you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
--   
--   <a>$sel:status:UpdateSigningCertificate'</a>,
--   <a>updateSigningCertificate_status</a> - The status you want to assign
--   to the certificate. <tt>Active</tt> means that the certificate can be
--   used for programmatic calls to Amazon Web Services <tt>Inactive</tt>
--   means that the certificate cannot be used.
newUpdateSigningCertificate :: Text -> StatusType -> UpdateSigningCertificate

-- | The name of the IAM user the signing certificate belongs to.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters consisting of upper and lowercase alphanumeric characters
--   with no spaces. You can also include any of the following characters:
--   _+=,.@-
updateSigningCertificate_userName :: Lens' UpdateSigningCertificate (Maybe Text)

-- | The ID of the signing certificate you want to update.
--   
--   This parameter allows (through its <a>regex pattern</a>) a string of
--   characters that can consist of any upper or lowercased letter or
--   digit.
updateSigningCertificate_certificateId :: Lens' UpdateSigningCertificate Text

-- | The status you want to assign to the certificate. <tt>Active</tt>
--   means that the certificate can be used for programmatic calls to
--   Amazon Web Services <tt>Inactive</tt> means that the certificate
--   cannot be used.
updateSigningCertificate_status :: Lens' UpdateSigningCertificate StatusType
